commit_message:
Add load_from_options_getter to plugin loading

Loading from getter function was introduced into keystoneclient as a way
to enable OCC and auth_token middleware to define more unusual loading
mechanisms.

It was skipped in the move to keystoneauth. This adds it back.

Closes-Bug: #1514339
Change-Id: I1d464917e0ddec8e13f9395ad75db6ccc53cb813

commit_message:
Added HTTP_X_FORWARDED_PROTO/HOST support to API

 * Added oslo.middleware's HTTPProxyToWSGI middleware
 * Deprecated designate's SSL middleware
 * Fixed "//" in versions URIs

Change-Id: Id205246f791f33fd02aa9a17d4247bdf5b310088

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-13 14:11:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Agent: Do not power off node if deployment fail

This patch is adding a configuration option to the drivers using the IPA
ramdisk (agent) called "power_off_deploy_fail", by default the value is
True and it will power off the node when deployment fails (just like
today). If set to False it will put the node in maintenance mode and
will not call power off. That's because the IPA ramdisk allows operators
to SSH into it and check the deployment logs to try to figure out why
it failed, and for that we need to keep the node powered on.

Closes-Bug: #1443374
Depends-On: Ifb69fddd0a595a4b9fceee37841a132c23c24968
Change-Id: Ie17dba05435248c9161737f93b3c4d87d0259002

commit_message:
Troubleshoot: Do not power off node if deployment fails

This patch is adding a configuration option to the drivers called
"power_off_deploy_fail", by default the value is True and it will power
off the node when deployment fails (just like today). If set to False it
will put the node in maintenance mode and will not call power off. The
option is specially useful when used with the IPA ramdisk, since it allows
operators to SSH into it and check the deployment logs to try to figure
out why it failed, and for that we need to keep the node powered on.

Closes-Bug: #1443374
Depends-On: Ifb69fddd0a595a4b9fceee37841a132c23c24968
Change-Id: Ie17dba05435248c9161737f93b3c4d87d0259002

subject: remove Python 2.6-specific logging workaround
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-13 20:30:34.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/utils.py'], 'message': "remove Python 2.6-specific logging workaround

0ff39c14 (December 2013) introduced this LoggingHandlerWeakRef to work
around a problem in which file descriptors would be leaked under Python
2.6. But we don't support 2.6 anymore.

Change-Id: I1cd8249dfe17bce9cb301d13b761c11d2efd11d3
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
remove Python 2.6-specific logging workaround

0ff39c14 (December 2013) introduced this LoggingHandlerWeakRef to work
around a problem in which file descriptors would be leaked under Python
2.6. But we don't support 2.6 anymore.

Change-Id: I1cd8249dfe17bce9cb301d13b761c11d2efd11d3

support queue based communication between evaluator and notifier

we don't need rpc and it's slower, let's stop using it.

commit_message:
fix some test cases wrongly skipped for mysql backend

There are 10 test cases which is skipped when we run mysql functional
test, because they are decorated by run_with(), which expects to be
handled by engine mysql, but gets engine mysql+pymysql.

This patch maps engine mysql+pymysql to mysql to enable these tests.

Change-Id: Ief0646b6ca66e514300cbc93d3e5e66b0573b590
Closes-Bug: #1519211

commit_message:
gnocchi: only evaluate the required eval_periods

The threshold evaluator retrieves one more evaluation_periods
from the backend via _statistic() and assumes _sanitize()
pick up only correct number of evaluation periods.

This fixes the gnocchi threshold evaluator to return
the correct number of evaluation periods.

Related-bug: #1506911
Related-bug: #1513092
Change-Id: Ic010d54d9e7c42d6d846fe76812cd0c0e5f0835e

docs: update the concept guide shelve actions

This updates the description of the shelve actions to include
shelve_offload. The text is slightly changed to keep the flow.

commit_message:
Freescale FWaaS Plugin code final decomposition.

This removes all the artifacts specific to Freescale FWaaS Plugin code
from the neutron-fwaas tree.

The code is maintained at github repository.

Setup option "fsl_firewall" for this plugin are removed in
change: I194a4da49058724766b7fde7343f85d19a75fe8c

UpgradeImpact

Change-Id: I5d419671cf3ce3dc10020949bc14bb9d8031da3f
Closes-Bug: #1519223

commit_message:
Allow saving and caching the plugin auth state

Particularly for allowing the CLI to store and reuse previous
authentication allow an application to extract and reinstall the
auth state from a plugin.

We provide a method that returns a dictionary of all of the identifiable
information that is used to create a plugin. This dictionary is hashed
to uniquely identify the plugin.

We then have a get_auth_state and set_auth_state function, the return of
which is intended to be opaque to the calling application. If the plugin
created returns an ID of an existing authentication you can call
set_auth_state to load that state. If the state is out of date it will
be refreshed as per normal otherwise it will be used instead of
authenticating again.

There is not support for caching federated tokens in this patch. They
will follow the exact same pattern and are not much harder they just
need a way for subclasses to signal they are cachable and so can be done
as a follow up.

Implements: bp cachable-auth
Change-Id: I4eebe7ff8060a37f19af5decfa3a8313cfb7c207

Reduced complexity of get_meter_statistics method

The get_meter_statistics method is very large - almost 100 lines
(in ceilometer/storage/impl_hbase.py).
I extracted some of the functionalities into helper functions
to reduce the length and complexity of get_meter_statistics.
Additionally it became more readable as well, without
changing its functionality.

The get_events method is very large - almost 100 lines
(in ceilometer/api/controllers/v2/query.py).

to reduce the length and complexity of __init__.
Additionally it became more readable as well, without
changing its functionality.

[{'created': '2015-11-24 13:38:53.000000000', 'files': ['aodh/tests/unit/test_notifier.py'], 'message': "remove unnecessary mock for rpc server start

latest oslo.messaging 3.0.0 requires invoking start() first then stop()
can be called, but we've mocked the start() which will hang the process
then finally raise TimeoutException.

Change-Id: I5a0e01cac52f9bf313bd06682660ff470b267c0c
Co-Authored-By: ZhiQiang Fan <aji.zqfan@gmail.com>
Closes-Bug: #1519182
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
remove unnecessary mock for rpc server start

latest oslo.messaging 3.0.0 requires invoking start() first then stop()
can be called, but we've mocked the start() which will hang the process
then finally raise TimeoutException.

Change-Id: I5a0e01cac52f9bf313bd06682660ff470b267c0c
Co-Authored-By: ZhiQiang Fan <aji.zqfan@gmail.com>
Closes-Bug: #1519182

commit_message:
Fixed incorrect name of 'tag' and 'tag-any' filters

According to spec
http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/mitaka/approved/tag-instances.html
these filters should be named 'tags' and 'tags-any'.

Closes-Bug: #1506786

Change-Id: If5fabe5c6afa3bf6cc8e5045250fefdce58e6930

commit_message:
[install] changed the note because it restarts two services

The current note says that only Apache HTTP service is
restarted by systemd command. However, the command actually
restarts both Apache HTTP service and memcached service.
Therefore, the note should be changed that the command restarts
each service.

Change-Id: Ie11da97213103d3b740cfce7c5e4a08aa5d48294
Partial-Bug: #1467994

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-02 15:25:01.000000000', 'files': ['lib/cinder_backends/solidfire', 'lib/cinder_backends/netapp_nfs', 'lib/cinder_backends/netapp_iscsi', 'lib/cinder_backends/vmdk', 'lib/cinder_backends/xiv'], 'message': "Remove closed source cinder backends

If we want to encourage people to use externally hosted plugins for devstack
we should make no exception.

Cleaning up devstack was discussed at Vancouver (see
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-QA-Devstack-Roadmap)

I don't want to be hard on the competition here, but people are confused. (see
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/186807/ and
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/177677/)

Change-Id: I07502173a8c6941d463615f6d7e2d057b98a17e0
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Remove closed source cinder backends

If we want to encourage people to use externally hosted plugins for devstack
we should make no exception.

Cleaning up devstack was discussed at Vancouver (see
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-QA-Devstack-Roadmap)

I don't want to be hard on the competition here, but people are confused. (see
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/186807/ and
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/177677/)

Change-Id: I07502173a8c6941d463615f6d7e2d057b98a17e0

commit_message:
Fixing issues spotted in dev environment

- removed own kafka abstraction in favour of monasca-common
- removed monasca keystone context filter, not actually used
- changed URI of logs endpoints to /v1.0/log/single

Change-Id: Iaceabdce2b2862451cfe63d2a612577d7710022b

commit_message:
Ensure designate-manage reads config before policy

With the designate-manage command, the policy file is read before
the configuration is parsed.

If the policy file is in a non-default location, all designate-manage
commands would fail.

Change-Id: Ic1e37c18cc61732db8df0d59cdb687b0167d63c0
Closes-Bug: 1519356

commit_message:
Ensure designate-manage reads config before policy

With the designate-manage command, the policy file is read before
the configuration is parsed.

If the policy file is in a non-default location, all designate-manage
commands would fail.

Change-Id: Ic1e37c18cc61732db8df0d59cdb687b0167d63c0
Closes-Bug: 1519356

subject: Fix race condition in V1 Records API
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-09-24 17:35:32.000000000', 'files': ['designate/tests/test_api/test_v1/test_records.py', 'designate/api/v1/records.py'], 'message': 'Fix race condition in V1 Records API

When listing records in the V1 API, two calls to central
are made - once for records once for recordsets - if the
content of either changes between the two calls, a failure
can occour. Instead, we already have all the data we need
so use it from the recordsets rather than make two calls

Change-Id: Ic43d7e8c0d60267ec4788b63ed5f7e88e7bbe625
Closes-Bug: 1487934
(cherry picked from commit eea5c1e8ad55d7ec17bf4695ba63efbc0e170784)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix race condition in V1 Records API

When listing records in the V1 API, two calls to central
are made - once for records once for recordsets - if the
content of either changes between the two calls, a failure
can occour. Instead, we already have all the data we need
so use it from the recordsets rather than make two calls

Change-Id: Ic43d7e8c0d60267ec4788b63ed5f7e88e7bbe625
Closes-Bug: 1487934
(cherry picked from commit eea5c1e8ad55d7ec17bf4695ba63efbc0e170784)

Ensure CNAME RRSets only have one record

commit_message:
Ensure blacklists complete in a reasonable time

Add a timeout around the blacklist regex matching, ensuring
that regex patterns and subjects which would otherwise take
many minutes to match return in a resonable time

Closes-Bug: 1497031

The history parameter wasn't passed to _get_pagination_options.
_get_pagination_options was adding a ? to the generated url parameters,

", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fixed history parameter having no effect on search

The history parameter wasn't passed to _get_pagination_options.
_get_pagination_options was adding a ? to the generated url parameters,
but the search was already doing it.

Change-Id: Id98dae88a090c14111eb3c9f31e41c10d9fc8fd1

commit_message:
test stable gnocchi branch

currently, the integration test will always test against
gnocchi-master. this means the gnocchi-stable branches are never tested.
this changes integration test to test the appropriate gnocchi-stable
branch corresponding to the stable releases of ceilometer and aodh.
with each gnocchi-stable release, the corresponding ceilometer|aodh
stable target may need to be adjusted.

Change-Id: I0d78d2268b87a5aaaae21b6d8712003b2e990417

commit_message:
Set puppet DIB_INSTALLTYPE in tripleo.sh not toci_instack.sh

Currently we override the puppet modules to build from source for CI
but that leads to tripleo.sh being broken for developers wanting to
set up a local environment matching what's in CI.

So, instead rely on tripleo.sh to setup the right version based on
the branch (e.g master or stable/liberty based on STABLE_RELEASE)

We still set up puppet.env so the DIB_REPOREF data is setup correctly
when we depend on an under-review puppet change.

This depends on the https://review.openstack.org/#/c/246447/ change to
tripleo.sh (merged for master tripleo-common), not using
Depends-On or this change will be blocked on the (not merged) liberty
patch.

Change-Id: Ia7615d7f6293e4a220e0121dbb5ea095b3bb5275

commit_message:
[contributor] Change RST inline markup conventions

:program:` ` markup is not widely used at our docs.
This convention become an inconsistency.
Also, this markup doesn't help translators.

Some discussion on docs mailing list:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-docs/2015-November/007892.html

Change-Id: I7efd24efc626ebfc5d73a2f23a1ee5e7ddfc00a4

commit_message:
Keystone_endpoint match service by name/type.

This enable keystone_endpoint to specify the type of the service
matched.  This way one can match services which are different only by
type and not only by name, like services nova/compute and nova/computev3
for instance.  It does so by fetching the _id_ of the service when it
has the type information instead of just using the name.

This should be required, and deprecation has been added, as the current
code work only because of a convention.

Change-Id: I9ea20fbad274d583485bc09a52b9df8000eb1af5
Closes-Bug: #1506996

'liberasurecode_rs_vand.'  This patch is to migrate over
the unit tests and swift.conf sample to the new ec_type.

This change ups the PyECLib requirement to >=1.0.7 as an
intermediate step to the upgrade to >=1.1.1:  Upper
constraint for CI is at ==1.0.7 at the moment and unless
Swift is updated to >=1.0.7, it (and global-requirements)
cannot be updated to >=1.1.1.

Related SAIO doc changes are part of a separate patch.

Change-Id: Idde727f855aeecc7da7570a4af3656af6bdbc779
", 'number': 5}]
commit_message:
EC: Use ec_type=liberasurecode_rs_vand in unit tests

To minimize external library dependencies for Swift unit
tests and SAIO, PyECLib 1.1.1 introduces a native backend
'liberasurecode_rs_vand.'  This patch is to migrate over
the unit tests and swift.conf sample to the new ec_type.

This change ups the PyECLib requirement to >=1.0.7 as an
intermediate step to the upgrade to >=1.1.1:  Upper
constraint for CI is at ==1.0.7 at the moment and unless
Swift is updated to >=1.0.7, it (and global-requirements)
cannot be updated to >=1.1.1.

Related SAIO doc changes are part of a separate patch.

Change-Id: Idde727f855aeecc7da7570a4af3656af6bdbc779

commit_message:
Add region support to nova providers

Nova providers did not previously have region support, so things like
the host aggregate provider do not work as expected in a multi-region
environment. This change mirrors what puppet-neutron's providers do,
they use the nova_region_name setting, this uses neutron/region_name.

Change-Id: I1d5bddbe977352b0458115ab77b8129311b63453
Closes-Bug: #1517220

commit_message:
No longer support configuring keystone under eventlet

This change removes devstack support for deploying keystone under
eventlet. This change should be merged as soon as development for
Mitaka has started (the stable/liberty branch has been cut) on
devstack.

Change-Id: I023ccc649c7ce674931ad638c6dd0d4c38a31e19

", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-06-18 09:58:47.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/tests/api/v2/test_acl_scenarios.py'], 'message': "Make acl_scenarios tests' keystonemiddleware cache work flexibly

Token cache keys in keystonemiddleware 2.0 are sha256 hashes of the

commit_message:
Make acl_scenarios tests' keystonemiddleware cache work flexibly

Token cache keys in keystonemiddleware 2.0 are sha256 hashes of the
token key. This is _not_ the case in keystonemiddleware <2.0. This
change adjusts the FakeMemcache to support both types of key.

Change-Id: Idcba48b227e8921a67f5af27f723810704ae790b

commit_message:
Dynamically find the extra partitioned block device

This provides support for using loopback devices for the extra
disk.

Closes-bug: #1518641

commit_message:
Convert gate to Ansible setup

To support multinode we must now distribute our setup to multiple
hosts. Instead of making special rules for this, we are going to
convert our existing setup to Ansible. This way both setup proceedures
take place in the exact same fashion.

Partially-Implements: blueprint multinode-gate
Change-Id: I43ece298bba994e9b5083403ef3cf6d4245cda6d

commit_message:
Xenapi: Handle missing aggregate metadata on startup

If the host added using aggregate function to slave host in
Xenserver environments, nova-compute does not start
because cannot get aggregate metadata information.

Co-authored-by: John Haan <yongiman@gmail.com>
Co-authored-by: Yoon Doyoul <ydoyeul@gmail.com>
Co-authored-by: Michael Still <mikal@stillhq.com>

Change-Id: Idc979d7b3a974f7f9f61e6cd3485bd7a7e0879ea
Closes-Bug: 1413475

commit_message:
Migrate libvirt volumes

This spec proposes using built-in libvirt volume transfer
methods to transfer libvirt volumes between compute nodes,
in order to facilitate cold migrations and resizes.

Spec for blueprint migrate-libvirt-volumes

Depends-On: Idc8e919627e2e01c2fa4599f15c9e2de614f41c3

Change-Id: I7b55d36e390207e7fea7e5ec75ccd29573850579

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-08-25 17:55:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': '[WIP] Support for Keystone as Service Provider

This patch implemts the class to configure Keystone
as a Service Provider

-This patch cover only Keystone as SP for K2K
 (Protocol is SAML and module is Shibboleth)
-Install required packages
-Configure keystone.conf file
-Restart keystone
Note: Keystone should be running over apache.

Change-Id: I32a1487c7674605124e6d0b182fe38ea4b58de87
Implements: blueprint enabling-federation

commit_message:
Support for Keystone as Service Provider

This patch implements the class to configure Keystone
as a Service Provider. It covers only Keystone as SP
for K2K (Protocol is SAML and module is Shibboleth)

On Debian based systems:
1- Configure keystone.conf
2- Install Shibboleth
3- Reconfigure the selected Keystone VirtualHost on Apache.

On RedHat based systems:
1- Configure keystone.conf
2- Reconfigure the selected Keystone VirtualHost on Apache.
Note: Step 2 will only execute if the user have add the extra repository
or installed shibboleth.
(About the extra repository, see:
https://wiki.shibboleth.net/confluence/display/SHIB2/NativeSPLinuxRPMInstall)

Implements: blueprint enabling-federation
Change-Id: I32a1487c7674605124e6d0b182fe38ea4b58de87

commit_message:
xen: mask passwords in volume connection_data dict

The connection_data dict can have credentials in it, so we need to scrub
those before putting the stringified dict into the StorageError message
and raising that up and when logging the dict.

Note that strutils.mask_password converts the dict to a string using
six.text_type so we don't have to do that conversion first.

SecurityImpact

Change-Id: Ic5f4d4c26794550a92481bf2b725ef5eafa581b2
Closes-Bug: #1516765
(cherry picked from commit 8b289237ed6d53738c22878decf0c429301cf3d0)

commit_message:
Enable update of network properties for nova server profile

This patch adds support for network properties update for
os.nova.server profile type. To update the network definition
of a nova server cluster/node, user can create a new profile instance
with 'networks' spec property changed and then use this new profile
to update cluster/node.

Change-Id: I9f4c8143b543fd689e4c095175753ed353aaa494
Implements: blueprint support-nova-server-update

commit_message:
Drop some outdated information from our quick start guide

* Only tox has to be installed via pip, everything else is in virtual
  environment. Nose is no longer used.
* One should NOT run other tox commands in an existing tox environment.
  This is not how tox is intended to be used, and it cause weird failures
  or seemingly random virtual environment rebuilds.
* Drop statement about running unit tests on a clear VM. Not sure where it
  comes from, only tox and setuptools are required to run unit tests,
  and they don't mess with system packages. Only leave note about devstack,
  as people seem to have problems with it.

Change-Id: Ie7d0172b66231cfd8f9c4f8f2d76604a187443b0

Make some classes inherit from NoDBTestCase

TestWSGIService and RootwrapDaemonTesetCase in
test_service.py and test_utils.py can be NoDBTestCase
because of no db access.

commit_message:
Remove unneeded 'self' in plugins.cdh.v5_4_0.plugin_utils

Should be no 'self' when using super to call method. Just remove it.

Change-Id: I2e0e6cf5efbe35b0f9d1b8a216160ce231cfda0a

(cherry picked from commit 84457eed830f0c0a80fcfc856332a191b91b096a)

commit_message:
Implement OpenStack client clouds.yml configuration file

OpenStack client supports defining one or more sets of credentials
inside a clouds.yml configuration file. A default configuration has
been created named `default` that contains the same admin credentials
from the `openrc` file currently being templated.

The default configuration can be specified using the following:

openstack --os-cloud default <command>

Change-Id: I62ac6fad7165cb07c551cdcf503e50ccd3cd3a56

subject: Fix HTTP error codes due to invalid templates
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-21 02:57:32.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/api/openstack_v1/test_stacks.py', 'heat/engine/environment.py', 'heat/engine/resources/openstack/heat/resource_group.py', 'heat/tests/test_provider_template.py', 'heat/tests/engine/test_resource_type.py', 'heat/engine/resources/template_resource.py', 'heat/tests/test_stack_resource.py', 'heat/engine/service.py', 'heat/tests/test_resource.py', 'heat/api/middleware/fault.py', 'heat/common/exception.py', 'heat/tests/test_resource_group.py', 'heat/engine/resource.py'], 'message': 'Fix HTTP error codes due to invalid templates

This reverts commit 9a4d719ea1a6ca63f527b5c78308fd288058d42b and creates a
new exception type, InvalidGlobalResource, that is raised when a
non-existent template is referenced in the global environment and which
results in an HTTP 500 error.

This fixes the cases where we could return 404 or 500 errors as a result of
template validation failures, when we should return a 400 error.

Change-Id: I3c7b3182957448bb13514696cc2e12f5aaddd253
Closes-Bug: #1518458
Related-Bug: #1447194
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix HTTP error codes due to invalid templates

This reverts commit 9a4d719ea1a6ca63f527b5c78308fd288058d42b and creates a
new exception type, InvalidGlobalResource, that is raised when a
non-existent template is referenced in the global environment and which
results in an HTTP 500 error.

This fixes the cases where we could return 404 or 500 errors as a result of
template validation failures, when we should return a 400 error.

Change-Id: I3c7b3182957448bb13514696cc2e12f5aaddd253
Closes-Bug: #1518458
Related-Bug: #1447194

commit_message:
Refactor the test for Fuel Master migration

Refactor the test to use template based approach:
- refactor the test to use template driven engine;
- add a new nodes config - 1 controller + 1 compute;
- add 2 new test configs - for VLAN and VXLAN net. providers
that use the new '1 controller + 1 compute' nodes config.

Change-Id: I586103f144bab73aa69b4239944ddf128919202b
Closes-bug: #1512677

subject: remove unnecessary mock for rpc server start
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-24 03:57:33.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'aodh/tests/unit/test_notifier.py'], 'message': "remove unnecessary mock for rpc server start

latest oslo.messaging 3.0.0 requires invoking start() first then stop()
can be called, but we've mocked the start() which will hang the process
then finally raise TimeoutException.

This patch removes unnecessary mock for rpc server start(), and bumps
oslo.messaging to align with global requirements.

Change-Id: If22df56a3b3af1e62b9f29fa1be1276d7cf7776d
Closes-Bug: #1519182
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
remove unnecessary mock for rpc server start

latest oslo.messaging 3.0.0 requires invoking start() first then stop()
can be called, but we've mocked the start() which will hang the process
then finally raise TimeoutException.

This patch removes unnecessary mock for rpc server start(), and bumps
oslo.messaging to align with global requirements.

Change-Id: If22df56a3b3af1e62b9f29fa1be1276d7cf7776d
Closes-Bug: #1519182

As discussed with Shuquan, I applied some changes:

* Retrieved subnet & mask bits (IPv4 & IPv6) from a new value in tempest conf file
* Check if the mask bits is not too small

commit_message:
Remove _keystone_identity method

_keystone_identity method has been maintained for backward
compatibility. But there is no place to use it now so this patch
replace _keystone_identity method to _integrated_keystone_identity
method as _keystone_identity.

Change-Id: I9464c047401f92ae31a5d3bb7aacaeb0624150e0

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-08-21 09:24:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Abstract environment template catalogue.

Continuing with the environment template catalog blueprint,
which allowed to define complex architecture for applications,
 an abstract environment template catalog can be included.
It involves the existence of an environment template catalogue independent on any user, which can be customized by anyone to include their concrete information (e.g. keypair). Concretely, it involves all the operations to manage environment templates (creation, deletion, updating), plus the customization done by the user. At the end, the customized environment template can be lanched and converted into an enviornment

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/murano/+spec/abstract-env-template

Change-Id: I702d9d707cb14195278b1cc2084fe9609660a3fe

commit_message:
Public environment template

This feature will allow having private and public environment templates, as well as,
to obtain all public templates from all tenants. In addition, a clone functionality
is added to copy a template from a tenant to another.

Change-Id: I702d9d707cb14195278b1cc2084fe9609660a3fe
Targets-blueprint: abstract-env-template

commit_message:
Let cluster-update return 400 if profile not found

This is part of a series of patches that correct the returned status
code when some referenced object cannot be found when performing
operations on some entities.

Change-Id: I74c595deff1784f24f27d1c810df08faf10bebc5
Partial-Bug: #1518209

commit_message:
Change admin IP ranges in tests for node groups

Change default IP addresses range for admin/pxe network
in system test for multiple cluster networks feature.
Check that DHCP range is configured properly and Nailgun
doesn't allocate excluded from range IPs to nodes.

Change-Id: I64069e287a6970b93931d93212efb0c1712af40a
Closes-bug: #1513154

commit_message:
Add 'mutable' param to Opt

re: https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/mitaka-cross-project-dynamic-config-services

oslo.config already offers a reload_config_files method. This patch adds
a 'mutable' flag to Opt, allowing services to mark which opts may be
reloaded. It also adds a flag to ConfigOpts, 'limit_mutation', to say
that when reload_config_files is called, only mutable opts should be
changed. If a new value for an immutable opt is detected, a warning is
issued.

Change-Id: I719874b58e64bc4f8535c85da43670779fbfd380

commit_message:
Make snapshot-name argument positional

Make "snapshot-name" argument mandatory
to avoid misunderstandings

Change-Id: I59a5723b8630068af8d947ea8903b007f98071c0
Closes-Bug: #1461079

commit_message:
Let cluster-create return 400 if profile not found

This is part of a series of patches to come that fix the return status
code of the HTTP API request. When referenced objects (not the entity
itself) is not found, we should return 400 (bad request) instead of 404
(not found).

Change-Id: I14a2dfed744ca41a1f288d14fe052c698f223827
Partial-Bug: #1518209

commit_message:
Fix with-items concurrency greater than the number of items

If the list provided to with-items has length less than the value provided
in concurrency, the engine throws an exception index out of range.

Change-Id: Ib9425f00a735c2fa09b685486aff02511094d991

commit_message:
Remove preprov provider dependencies from CONF

This commit removes the last dependencie of the preprov
provider from CONF. The required configuration is passed
now as parameters at init time.

As the number of parameter grows, and many of them are taken from
configuration, adding dicts with parameters that can be used
when instantiating the credentials providers.

Depends-on: I0ca0b96fc618ffe60851984a9c6d46b0507878d4
Partially-implements: bp tempest-library
Change-Id: I945994580ce9a29f6fbf67183e5da4b100542386

commit_message:
Refactor firewall to listen on only on internal networks

Refactors firewall rules to create source
based rules that only permit connections
from the management network for most services.

The only services that should have public access
are Horizon and OpenStack APIs. And from those,
nova metadata and nova VNC should only be
accessible internally. All other services should
accept connections from private or storage
networks.

New defined type openstack::firewall::multi_net
accepts firewall definitions with an array of
source networks.

New function prepare_firewall_rules creates a hash
of firewall rules coming from an array of source
networks.

Removed unneeded openstack::firewall::allow class.
Obsoleted openstack::firewall:vnc defined type.

Sorted parameters on openstack::firewall and added
docstrings

DocImpact: TBD

Change-Id: Ie63c01dcbd0bbd9adf17363b0db0b0a99b837b4e
Closes-Bug: #1514014

commit_message:
Networks tab does not show external configuration

When you create a network you can specify it as
external network. When the network is listed
in Horizon 'Networks' tab we do not see any
column indicating if network is 'external' .
It is nice to enhance the network tab to add a
new column showing 'external' indicating whether
network is 'external'.

Change-Id: I5cbd612b47f842fcb669b72ee4bf076ccd554356
Close-Bug:#1350237

commit_message:
msgpackutils: drop Python 2.6 support

We doesn't support python 2.6 now, this commit
removes Python 2.6 related code in module msgpackutls.

Change-Id: Id148239ee6c1ad461188fa38b06ca0d7913d7454

commit_message:
Align requirements to liberty global-requirements

Now requirements.txt and test-requirements.txt are
aligned to global-requirements.txt of stable/Liberty.

Testing requirements are now move to test-requirements.txt
from tox.ini

Also the author, author-email and home-page are now update to
reflect Freezer Team and openstack-dev ml.

Change-Id: I27f2ea875778f19d2ffb542b9b8fbf29d1a740fe

', 'number': 10}, {'created': '2015-11-11 08:39:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Move to template-based configuration of devops environments

To create a devops virtual environment (networks, volumes, nodes),
now can be used YAML template desctibed in [1].

How it can be used:

* New approach, environment will be created using the data from
  full_config object:

  environment.create_environment(full_config)

* Old-style approach (deprecated), in this case at first will be
  created a 'full_config' object using shell environment variables,
  and then called environment.create_environment(full_config):

  environment.describe_environment(boot_from='cdrom'):

* Override old-style approach, in this case the YAML config will
  be taken from the file located in DEVOPS_SETTINGS_TEMPLATE shell
  environment variable instead of variables from settings.py:

  export DEVOPS_SETTINGS_TEMPLATE=/tmp/some_template_file.yaml

- add create_envoronment() method that creates environment from
  provided config
- add template generator for keep legacy behaviour of the
  method describe_environment()
- Environment.define() is deprecated and left for back compatibility
  with older fuel-qa branches
- Some objects in template require the extended database schema,
  so in this patch there are some workarounds to use templates with
  original schema (particular data from address_pools and
  l2_network_devices are stored in the Network model)

[1] - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/240170/

Change-Id: Iad081bee94c4d3b404eda57b7c1c31011b837ba7
Implements: blueprint template-based-testcases
", 'number': 11}, {'created': '2015-11-11 08:48:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Move to template-based configuration of devops environments

To create a devops virtual environment (networks, volumes, nodes),
now can be used YAML template desctibed in [1].

How it can be used:

* New approach, environment will be created using the data from
  full_config object:

  environment.create_environment(full_config)

* Old-style approach (deprecated), in this case at first will be
  created a 'full_config' object using shell environment variables,
  and then called environment.create_environment(full_config):

  environment.describe_environment(boot_from='cdrom'):

* Override old-style approach, in this case the YAML config will
  be read from the file located in DEVOPS_SETTINGS_TEMPLATE shell
  environment variable to the 'full_config' object and passed to
  create_environment(full_config); creating config in old-style
  will be skipped:

  export DEVOPS_SETTINGS_TEMPLATE=/tmp/some_template_file.yaml

- add create_envoronment() method that creates environment from
  provided config
- add template generator for keep legacy behaviour of the
  method describe_environment()
- Environment.define() is deprecated and left for back compatibility
  with older fuel-qa branches
- Some objects in template require the extended database schema,
  so in this patch there are some workarounds to use templates with
  original schema (particular data from address_pools and
  l2_network_devices are stored in the Network model)

[1] - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/240170/

Change-Id: Iad081bee94c4d3b404eda57b7c1c31011b837ba7
Implements: blueprint template-based-testcases
", 'number': 12}, {'created': '2015-11-11 14:35:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Move to template-based configuration of devops environments

To create a devops virtual environment (networks, volumes, nodes),
now can be used YAML template desctibed in [1].

How it can be used:

* New approach, environment will be created using the data from
  full_config object:

  environment.create_environment(full_config)

* Old-style approach (deprecated), in this case at first will be
  created a 'full_config' object using shell environment variables,
  and then called environment.create_environment(full_config):

  environment.describe_environment(boot_from='cdrom'):

* Override old-style approach, in this case the YAML config will
  be read from the file located in DEVOPS_SETTINGS_TEMPLATE shell
  environment variable to the 'full_config' object and passed to
  create_environment(full_config); creating config in old-style
  will be skipped:

  export DEVOPS_SETTINGS_TEMPLATE=/tmp/some_template_file.yaml

- add create_envoronment() method that creates environment from
  provided config. There is performed define() and describe()
  actions for each object, so calling environment.describe() is not
  required later.
- add template generator for keep legacy behaviour of the
  method describe_environment()
- Environment.define() is deprecated and left for back compatibility
  with older fuel-qa branches
- Some objects in template require the extended database schema,
  so in this patch there are some workarounds to use templates with
  original schema (particular data from address_pools and
  l2_network_devices are stored in the Network model)

[1] - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/240170/

Change-Id: Iad081bee94c4d3b404eda57b7c1c31011b837ba7
Implements: blueprint template-based-testcases
", 'number': 13}, {'created': '2015-11-12 17:03:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Move to template-based configuration of devops environments

To create a devops virtual environment (networks, volumes, nodes),
now can be used YAML template desctibed in [1].

How it can be used:

* New approach, environment will be created using the data from
  full_config object:

  environment.create_environment(full_config)

* Old-style approach (deprecated), in this case at first will be
  created a 'full_config' object using shell environment variables,
  and then called environment.create_environment(full_config):

  environment.describe_environment(boot_from='cdrom'):

* Override old-style approach, in this case the YAML config will
  be read from the file located in DEVOPS_SETTINGS_TEMPLATE shell
  environment variable to the 'full_config' object and passed to
  create_environment(full_config); creating config in old-style
  will be skipped:

  export DEVOPS_SETTINGS_TEMPLATE=/tmp/some_template_file.yaml

- add create_envoronment() method that creates environment from
  provided config.
- environment.describe() method is temporary disabled until new
  database schema be implemented, where all necessary details could
  be passed from define() to desctibe() via database objects.
- add template generator for keep legacy behaviour of the
  method describe_environment()
- Environment.define() is deprecated and left for back compatibility
  with older fuel-qa branches
- Some objects in template require the extended database schema,
  so in this patch there are some workarounds to use templates with
  original schema (particular data from address_pools and
  l2_network_devices are stored in the Network model)

commit_message:
Move to template-based configuration of devops environments

To create a devops virtual environment (networks, volumes, nodes),
now can be used YAML template desctibed in [1].

How it can be used:

* New approach, environment will be created using the data from
  full_config object:

  environment.create_environment(full_config)

* Old-style approach (deprecated), in this case at first will be
  created a 'full_config' object using shell environment variables,
  and then called environment.create_environment(full_config):

  environment.describe_environment(boot_from='cdrom'):

* Override old-style approach, in this case the YAML config will
  be read from the file located in DEVOPS_SETTINGS_TEMPLATE shell
  environment variable to the 'full_config' object and passed to
  create_environment(full_config); creating config in old-style
  will be skipped:

  export DEVOPS_SETTINGS_TEMPLATE=/tmp/some_template_file.yaml

- add create_envoronment() method that creates environment from
  provided config.
- environment.describe() method is temporary disabled until new
  database schema be implemented, where all necessary details could
  be passed from define() to desctibe() via database objects.
- add template generator for keep legacy behaviour of the
  method describe_environment()
- Environment.define() is deprecated and left for back compatibility
  with older fuel-qa branches
- Some objects in template require the extended database schema,
  so in this patch there are some workarounds to use templates with
  original schema (particular data from address_pools and
  l2_network_devices are stored in the Network model)

[1] - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/240170/

Change-Id: Iad081bee94c4d3b404eda57b7c1c31011b837ba7
Implements: blueprint template-based-virtual-devops-environments

commit_message:
Fix bootstrap for services

The bootstrap tasks could be started on any node listed in the
site.yml

The issue is that all the tasks must run on the same node, and the
only node that all the tasks can run on is the 'api' node due to
needing to start the bootstrap container which binds in the configs.

delegate_to is required to ensure that the proper node gets the task.

Co-Authored-By: Sam Yaple <sam@yaple.net>
Change-Id: Ica04ab366777a571a92212ac22c482f1881d4ecd
Closes-Bug: #1513598
Related-Bug: #1513439
(cherry picked from commit 790bf336d5e082c5c079bfb681f9509188eae72f)

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-10-14 12:22:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Rewrite table filtering to use GET-requests

Before this patch server table filtering was built on
POST requests, wich is conceptually wrong and makes
impossible to filter data on redirect to the table.

This patch rewrites server table filtering to use
GET request by changing methods get_filter_string() and
get_filter_field().
Also this patch adds some js-code to handle actions in
the filter form.
Now url can contain filtering information, which makes
possible to redirect user to filtered table.
This patchset contains implementation only for table
project/instances to facilitate understanding of the
proposed approach.

Change-Id: I4910295e5fe17ba15f0d8b873131da795747ee80
Closes-Bug: #1368338

commit_message:
Rewrite table filtering to use GET-requests

Before this patch server table filtering was built on
POST requests, wich is conceptually wrong and makes
impossible to filter data on redirect to the table.

This patch rewrites server table filtering to use
GET request by changing methods get_filter_string() and
get_filter_field().
Also this patch adds some js-code to handle actions in
the filter form.
Now url can contain filtering information, which makes
possible to redirect user to filtered table.

Change-Id: I4910295e5fe17ba15f0d8b873131da795747ee80
Closes-Bug: #1368338
Co-Authored-By: Timur Sufiev <tsufiev@mirantis.com>

while actually we provide mysql+pymysql, so these test cases will be

commit_message:
fix some test case wrongly skipped for mysql backend

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/235831/ enables all test cases for
ysql when PyMySQL is used as MySQL driver, but some test cases are
specified via run_with() decorator, which might expect engine is mysql
while actually we provide mysql+pymysql, so these test cases will be
wrongly skipped.

This patch maps mysql+pymysql to mysql to make sure there is an engine
handles it for such case.

Change-Id: I062d1d04b4b1511626a9b02f0249b5c93b5592b8
Closes-Bug: #1519211

subject: Fix CONF.set_override usage
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-20 05:28:42.000000000', 'files': ['senlin/tests/unit/engine/test_senlin_lock.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/common/base.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/drivers/test_driver.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/engine/service/test_policies.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/engine/service/test_webhooks.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/middleware/test_webhook_middleware.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/apiv1/test_clusters.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/drivers/test_nova_v2.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/test_wsgi.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/engine/service/test_profiles.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/test_common_utils.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/apiv1/test_nodes.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/engine/service/test_nodes.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/engine/service/test_triggers.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/drivers/test_keystone_v3.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/engine/service/test_clusters.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/middleware/test_fault_middleware.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/profiles/test_nova_server.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/middleware/test_context_middleware.py'], 'message': "Fix CONF.set_override usage

As mentioned in the following mail thread [1], when using CONF.set_override,
we'd better explicitly specify 'enforce_type=True', or else there is a
risk that what we are testing is not what users will be using. While the
oslo.config project may fix this param to be default to True, each
project using this call is encouraged to set it.

[1]
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-November/079633.html

Change-Id: I09f9e667cc01b6cb4b7fb5003527608a44f9a6bc
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix CONF.set_override usage

As mentioned in the following mail thread [1], when using CONF.set_override,
we'd better explicitly specify 'enforce_type=True', or else there is a
risk that what we are testing is not what users will be using. While the
oslo.config project may fix this param to be default to True, each
project using this call is encouraged to set it.

[1]
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-November/079633.html

Change-Id: I09f9e667cc01b6cb4b7fb5003527608a44f9a6bc

[{'created': '2015-11-18 10:25:33.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/contrib/s3/core.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_contrib_s3_core.py'], 'message': "Fix string conversion in s3 handler for python 2

creds_ref['secret'] in s3/ec2 controller has type unicode.
and result type of six.b('AWS4' + secret) is an unicode.
but hmac.new decoder can't work with unicode strings - it
needs 'str' type in python 2.
So here simple change is needed - encode result string as 'utf-8'.
Same conversion we have in signature v1 checking.

Also two comments from previous review was fixed.

Change-Id: I80d862956eace35753f00459d49150a62f07101a
Related-Bug: #1473042
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix string conversion in s3 handler for python 2

creds_ref['secret'] in s3/ec2 controller has type unicode.
and result type of six.b('AWS4' + secret) is an unicode.
but hmac.new decoder can't work with unicode strings - it
needs 'str' type in python 2.
So here simple change is needed - encode result string as 'utf-8'.
Same conversion we have in signature v1 checking.

Also two comments from previous review was fixed.

Change-Id: I80d862956eace35753f00459d49150a62f07101a
Related-Bug: #1473042

commit_message:
Add parameter sanitization for policy-attach

This patch adds logic to sanitize the parameters provided to a
policy-attach call. The parameter types and values are validated. If
any of the validations fail, a webob.HTTPBadRequest is thrown.

Change-Id: I4a081de911cf0fd2cf8ded1ab1b8c0e0f7b83c7a
Closes-Bug: #1465509

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-07-01 14:14:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Replace parse_strtime() with parse_isotime()

* Replace parse_strtime(ts) with parse_isotime(ts)
* Replace parse_strtime(ts, fmt) with
  datetime.datetime.strptime(ts, fmt)
* simple_tenant_usage.py: replace the loop trying 3 different timestamp
  format with parse_strtime() with parse_isotime(), parse_isotime()
  already supports the 3 tested formats (and more)
* test_apirequest.py: use directly the datetime.datetime() constructor
  instead of parsing a string
* test_cells_messaging.py: mock parse_isotime() using mock.patch instead
  of mocking it using mox (mock API is simpler than mox API)

oslo_utils.timeutils.parse_isotime() is a superset of parse_strtime().
parse_isotime() accepts timestamps without microseconds and timestamps
with timezone, whereas parse_strtime() requires a timestamp formatted by
strtime() (with microseconds and without any timezone information).

parse_isotime() always create "aware" datetime objects: with a timezone
information. If the timestamp has no timezone information, the UTC
timezone is used by default.

This change is required to prepare nova to replace
oslo_utils.timeutils.strtime(), function deprecated in oslo.utils 1.6.
It is suggested to replace strtime(ts) with ts.isoformat().
parse_strtime() raises an error on timestamp without microsecond,
whereas the .isoformat() method omits microseconds in the output (the
".000000" suffix) if the microsecond attribute is equal to zero:

    >>> timeutils.strtime(datetime.datetime(2015, 7, 1, 10, 24, 22))
    '2015-07-01T10:24:22.000000'
    >>> datetime.datetime(2015, 7, 1, 10, 24, 22).isoformat()
    '2015-07-01T10:24:22'

Change-Id: I591b55be2a7552c5da6f2a0bcd758023210f67d6
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-07-01 14:29:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Replace parse_strtime() with parse_isotime()

* Replace parse_strtime(ts) with parse_isotime(ts)
* Replace parse_strtime(ts, fmt) with
  datetime.datetime.strptime(ts, fmt)
* simple_tenant_usage.py: replace the loop trying 3 different timestamp
  format with parse_strtime() with parse_isotime(), parse_isotime()
  already supports the 3 tested formats (and more)
* test_apirequest.py: use directly the datetime.datetime() constructor
  instead of parsing a string
* test_cells_messaging.py: mock parse_isotime() using mock.patch instead
  of mocking it using mox (mock API is simpler than mox API)
* db/sqlalchemy/api.py: since parse_strtime() is replaced with
  parse_isotime(), there is no need to fallback on parse_isotime() on
  error

oslo_utils.timeutils.parse_isotime() is a superset of parse_strtime().
parse_isotime() accepts timestamps without microseconds and timestamps
with timezone, whereas parse_strtime() requires a timestamp formatted by
strtime() (with microseconds and without any timezone information).

parse_isotime() always create "aware" datetime objects: with a timezone
information. If the timestamp has no timezone information, the UTC
timezone is used by default.

This change is required to prepare nova to replace
oslo_utils.timeutils.strtime(), function deprecated in oslo.utils 1.6.
It is suggested to replace strtime(ts) with ts.isoformat().
parse_strtime() raises an error on timestamp without microsecond,
whereas the .isoformat() method omits microseconds in the output (the
".000000" suffix) if the microsecond attribute is equal to zero:

    >>> timeutils.strtime(datetime.datetime(2015, 7, 1, 10, 24, 22))
    '2015-07-01T10:24:22.000000'
    >>> datetime.datetime(2015, 7, 1, 10, 24, 22).isoformat()
    '2015-07-01T10:24:22'

Change-Id: I591b55be2a7552c5da6f2a0bcd758023210f67d6

commit_message:
Replace parse_strtime() with parse_isotime()

* Replace parse_strtime(ts) with parse_isotime(ts)
* Replace parse_strtime(ts, fmt) with
  datetime.datetime.strptime(ts, fmt)
* simple_tenant_usage.py: replace the loop trying 3 different timestamp
  format with parse_strtime() with parse_isotime(), parse_isotime()
  already supports the 3 tested formats (and more)
* test_apirequest.py: use directly the datetime.datetime() constructor
  instead of parsing a string
* test_cells_messaging.py: mock parse_isotime() using mock.patch instead
  of mocking it using mox (mock API is simpler than mox API)
* db/sqlalchemy/api.py: since parse_strtime() is replaced with
  parse_isotime(), there is no need to fallback on parse_isotime() on
  error

oslo_utils.timeutils.parse_isotime() is a superset of parse_strtime().
parse_isotime() accepts timestamps without microseconds and timestamps
with timezone, whereas parse_strtime() requires a timestamp formatted by
strtime() (with microseconds and without any timezone information).

parse_isotime() always create "aware" datetime objects: with a timezone
information. If the timestamp has no timezone information, the UTC
timezone is used by default.

This change is required to prepare nova to replace
oslo_utils.timeutils.strtime(), function deprecated in oslo.utils 1.6.
It is suggested to replace strtime(ts) with ts.isoformat().
parse_strtime() raises an error on timestamp without microsecond,
whereas the .isoformat() method omits microseconds in the output (the
".000000" suffix) if the microsecond attribute is equal to zero:

    >>> timeutils.strtime(datetime.datetime(2015, 7, 1, 10, 24, 22))
    '2015-07-01T10:24:22.000000'
    >>> datetime.datetime(2015, 7, 1, 10, 24, 22).isoformat()
    '2015-07-01T10:24:22'

blueprint liberty-olso-sync

Change-Id: I591b55be2a7552c5da6f2a0bcd758023210f67d6

commit_message:
Mellanox ethernet driver (mlx4_en) autoloading together with core driver

Mellanox ethernet driver (mlx4_en) should be loaded together together with
core driver (mlx4_core).

This fix for default CentOS provision image taken from the libmlx4 package.

Change-Id: Ic1c26ff610fc657d05a854e81cf3681f3eeb0c45
Closes-Bug: #1501309

commit_message:
Quota Policy Engine

There are many different ways that deployers may want to slice
their private cloud - availability zones, aggregates exposed
via flavors and special flavors being the most common amongst
all the available options. There are different ways to impose
quota based on the slice mechanism used. Quota policy engine
provide a way to validate whether a particular quota operation
is valid or not depending on the actual resource consumption
and what is requested by the incoming request.

Change-Id: I88c73d051e324bebe46d6f9df6067fa9330e70a8
Implements: blueprint quota-policy-engine

[{'created': '2015-07-27 17:30:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Provide support for creating dynamic quota resources

blueprint dynamic-quota-resource

Change-Id: I13b8e15896ffcb7d3aafe6bffb394ef1c8f487ca
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-07-27 18:34:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Quota Management for Dynamic Quota Resources

During creation or deletion of an instance, quota needs to be calculated
and committed or rollbacked accordingly. Currently, quota calculations
are based on 14 static resources hardcoded in the quota module. These
static resources are cores, ram, disk, instances and so on. At present,
there is no support provided for an openstack admin to create dynamic
quota resources and assign quota for a specific project, based on the
newly created dynamic resource. Dynamic resource can be a combination
of availability zone, flavor, hardware type or any key-value pair that
the admin chooses. This spec plans to provide an option to
create and manage the dynamic resource through instance lifecycle and
also provide a way for quota management of these newly introduced
dynamic resources.

Co-Authored-By: Vilobh Meshram <vilobhmm@yahoo-inc.com>
Co-Authored-By: Joshua Harlow <harlowja@yahoo-inc.com>

blueprint dynamic-quota-resource

Change-Id: I13b8e15896ffcb7d3aafe6bffb394ef1c8f487ca
', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2015-07-28 00:26:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Quota Management for Dynamic Quota Resources

During creation or deletion of an instance, quota needs to be calculated
and committed or rollbacked accordingly. Currently, quota calculations
are based on 14 static resources hardcoded in the quota module. These

there is no support provided for an openstack admin to create dynamic
quota resources and assign quota for a specific project, based on the
newly created dynamic resource. Dynamic resource can be a combination
of availability zone, flavor, hardware type or any random resource key
that the admin chooses. Also, admin can add more metadata (key-value
pairs) to dynamic quota resources. This metadata can be used for
providing more information to the end-user as well as during selection
of hardware. This spec plans to provide an option to create and manage
the dynamic resource through instance lifecycle and

commit_message:
Quota by Flavor, Quota by AZ or Quota by (Flavor and AZ)

There are multiple ways to slice an Openstack cloud - availability
zones, aggregates exposed via flavors and special flavors being the
most common amongst all the available options. These options are used
for better operability, managebility and providing specific
features to enhance performance. But even though we have a way to
segregate the cloud as per these options, at present, there is
no option provided for an Openstack admin to set and manage Quota
by Flavor, Quota by AZ or both.

This spec plans to solve this problem by introducing the concept
of dynamic resources. A dynamic resource can be a combination of
availability zone, flavor or hardware type aggregate exposed via
a flavor which can help for effective quota management in these
common deployment scenarios.

Co-Authored-By: Vilobh Meshram <vilobhmm@yahoo-inc.com>
Co-Authored-By: Joshua Harlow <harlowja@yahoo-inc.com>
blueprint dynamic-quota-resource
Change-Id: I13b8e15896ffcb7d3aafe6bffb394ef1c8f487ca

commit_message:
Limit the number of instances that a user can spawn in a time window

Rate-limits can limit API calls, but on POST */servers, there is
a possibility to specify max_count and ask large number of instances
in a very short time.
As operator, I want to rate-limit the real instance creation, not
only the API calls.

Change-Id: I49ade2885bab4671474567e72c892de6c2677778

commit_message:
deprecate `enabled` option for endpoint-policy extension

the endpoint-policy extension, like the other recently moved
extensions, should be always enabled. Since this option made
its way into the liberty release we need to mark the option
as deprecated in M and remove it in O

implements bp: move-extensions

Change-Id: I5c01da0663c636bc6e2d9f12ac02b53edb9a277f

commit_message:
Host maintenance mode

Provide a default host maintenance mode handling to enable compute node
machines to upgrade OS or hardware without pausing running instances in
Nova compute, independant to drivers.

Implements: blueprint host-maintenance-mode
Change-Id: Icd4a3e40c8f3aa0af7729a868ebc64f84a7857c9

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-09-28 05:04:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Live migrate local disk

User is not allowed to execute live-migration of
a booted from volume instance which have a local disk
in non-shared storage environment.
This blueprint make it enable by copying local disk
from the source host to the destination host.

commit_message:
Live migrate local disk

User is not allowed to execute live-migration of
a booted from volume instance which have a local disk
in non-shared storage environment.
This blueprint make it enable by copying local disk
from the source host to the destination host.

Blueprint: live-migrate-local-disk
Change-Id: I1a44685cbbed7364b8bb8566075f67f481d3a1c4

commit_message:
Really skip directories for translation sync

This fixes a problem on stable/liberty for openstack-manuals where only
2 out of 12 directories should be translated. But we currently push all
12 source files to the server.

If we have directories that contain locale files, we need to explicitly
exclude them. Add the skip directories to the exclude list for
manual projects.

Change-Id: I1eb481772545261c293baa0eb35731a8ac92d53c

commit_message:
tripleo.sh initial support for stable branches

Adds STABLE_RELEASE variable, which can be set, e.g to "liberty"
such that we configure the repos to use the centos7-liberty current
repos instead of trunk.

This automates the steps documented in:
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/238600/

Change-Id: I34ea635382114bf4f075f3d8df1188c3beae8727
(cherry picked from commit 17209ca9d6a980201dbee90f1699f07baf118aca)

commit_message:
Disallow profile update for spec

Previously we support creating new profiles when doing profile-update,
if a new 'spec' is provided. However, this looks like an abuse of the
'update' operation. It creates more confusion than convenience. This
patch proposes removing 'spec' from the update interface. More patches
will come to remove this completely. This is only about the API and the
RPC client layer.

Change-Id: Id8edf1d1bcb33f85dbdad614dd4db27285f17d0a

commit_message:
scan all changes and filter on files in reno not git log

Scanning only changes with reno files in them means we miss some of the
git tags in the repository history, so include all patches in the git
log output and then filter them in reno based on patches that include
any release notes files.

Closes-bug: #1517175
Change-Id: I36c0a54e20d47fff9af2b7f82c5380d97345a625

commit_message:
Fix bug introduced by openstacksdk

This patch sets the default auth_plugin to 'password', it also removes
the authenticator reference from client module. These code are breaking
the client code.

Change-Id: I7f815d3847b0bd0f5e6c3f78c2cc0efd3c80a523

commit_message:
remove elasticsearch method delete_by_query

The elasticsearch method delete_by_query has been removed
from the api because deprecated since elasticsearch 1.7

see:
https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/1.7/docs-delete-by-query.html

Change-Id: Ib21708c7147f4202eb7e4dba7a64adbc192d94af

commit_message:
Mellanox ethernet driver (mlx4_en) autoloading together with core driver

Mellanox ethernet driver (mlx4_en) should be loaded together together with
core driver (mlx4_core).

This fix for default CentOS provision image taken from the libmlx4 package.

Change-Id: Ic1c26ff610fc657d05a854e81cf3681f3eeb0c45
Closes-Bug: #1501309

commit_message:
Mellanox ethernet driver (mlx4_en) autoloading together with core driver

Mellanox ethernet driver (mlx4_en) should be loaded together together with
core driver (mlx4_core).

This fix for default CentOS provision image taken from the libmlx4 package.

Change-Id: Ic1c26ff610fc657d05a854e81cf3681f3eeb0c45
Closes-Bug: #1501309

subject: Fixed broken assignment to dictionary using integer key
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-14 18:59:55.000000000', 'files': ['murano/dsl/lhs_expression.py'], 'message': 'Fixed broken assignment to dictionary using integer key

The case

$dict[$key]: value

for integer $key was not addressed in LHS expression logic.
As a result no changes were made to $dict and no error was raised.

Change-Id: I969dab5f0d32312cf52490945934557c32f22dde
Closes-Bug: #1515612
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fixed broken assignment to dictionary using integer key

The case

$dict[$key]: value

for integer $key was not addressed in LHS expression logic.
As a result no changes were made to $dict and no error was raised.

Change-Id: I969dab5f0d32312cf52490945934557c32f22dde

commit_message:
Refactor function configure_default_route

Before the function configure_default_route was a little part of function
generate_network_config which changed default gateway only, due to the provider
for interfaces was not picked correctly.
Now if default route is needed to change we just modify network_scheme
and call generate_network_config with this network_scheme, if no - do
nothing.
Leave only provider lnx as default for l23_stored_config.

Change-Id: I33e88550af5d5cce2886254444ee5d450e578a1c
Closes-bug: #1510072

commit_message:
Allow filtering using unicode characters

Current code forces the filter arguments to be converted
to a byte string using str() which prevents filtering
using unicode characters. This patch fixes that.

Change-Id: I3abef5da4c2614806011440a4443e869920b4afd
Partial-Bug: 1472999

commit_message:
Allow a plugin to use custom swift role name

Plugins may define custom role names. If no custom role are defined,
the default one are used.

Partially implements: blueprint detach-components-from-controllers
Change-Id: Iae606c2db13a79161b45bcb00a401a6a239d90d7

commit_message:
Fix default domain.

After the move to composite namevar a problem could occur if another
module was using indirection to find resource by name.

If the manifest didn't have any
keystone_user/keystone_tenant/keystone_user_role definition, then, the
'Default' domain would be appended to the name.

This patch, fix that by simplifying the rule for calculating the default
domain.

It now strictly follows what is described there https://review.openstack.org/#/c/219127/

Change-Id: Ic2efb51fe76d055307c8c27fa79015764417160b
Closes-Bug: #1517187

commit_message:
Add parameters to nova

    Added options:

	api_paste_config
	fping_path
	allow_resize_to_same_host
	use_local
	live_migration_flag
	block_migration_flag
	multi_host
	auto_assign_floating_ip

Change-Id: I4665344bb0049fe2b7080c2f4dbca01e011f4f1d

', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Bump RAM to 1G for ironic-inspector IPA job

This is in line with what Ironic IPA job requires, and this is the most
likely cause of current gate failures. Lower VM count to 1 to reduce
load on infra.

Change-Id: I742410a961aec807980443110ebe97673e7359a6

commit_message:
Switch Ansible role jobs to use 'dsvm-functional-trusty'

This patch switches the Ansible role checks to use the
'dsvm-functional-trusty' job so that it has sudo access.

Change-Id: Ic8d6afd2d72ac8d6bd4290a39a57ec6d8706207b
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Log error instead of exception trace

In impl_vsctl we rather use LOG.error instead of
LOG.exception. In these case the exception trace did not provide
any valuable information.

Change-Id: Ia02f000d460b3aee72a31e9963e5d0e0d4c68315
Closes-bug: #1518429

commit_message:
Floating IP range support in Nova network

This patch provides a possibility to add
ip ranges of networks (i.e.: 192.168.1.210-192.168.1.224)
to a floating ip pool.

Depends-On: I802280e4e2912c9aed1c10d519ead84b1f22f900

Change-Id: Iffb0af32753708decb8d2b60f1075b66f7520553

commit_message:
remove python26-jobs from remaining oslo libraries

The Oslo team is dropping python 2.6 support for all libraries. Many
already have the jobs removed, but a few didn't. This patch cleans up
the remaining libraries, except pbr which has to continue to be tested
with 2.6 until all of its consuming projects have dropped 2.6 support.

Change-Id: I516356b4d2e39c092acc667c8f493f02a3050a19

commit_message:
Add hosted agents list to dhcp agent scheduler

Availability zone aware dhcp scheduler uses hosted agents list
to schedule dhcp agent to proper availability zone.
The scheduler can avoid scheduling the same availalibity zone as
agents host a network which should be distributed for HA.

Change-Id: Ib01f6d852956dc1e89b83321d657c0baf829e28a
Partially-implements: blueprint add-availability-zone

Record diagnostic info from bay nodes

In functional tests, copy logs from bay nodes to host before the
tests tear down. The bay node logs could be helpful for
trouble-shooting.

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-23 14:57:02.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_tracker.py', 'nova/compute/resource_tracker.py'], 'message': "Fix resource tracker VCPU counting

The resource track is double counting the number of
vcpus used because it counts the virt driver's view
and the resource tracker's view. It should reset
the count to 0 before counting the resourcet racker's
view. this is done for other resources (memory, disk)
in _update_usage_from_instances().

This was not caught in unit tests because they always
provide a virt driver view with no resource used for
tests that assume instances are already running.

This patch adds the reset to 0 and modifies the
tests to provide correct counts of used resources
from the virt driver.

Change-Id: I21acfd7d5b5ed442cd1e9049c986a06bd2b59b81
Closes-Bug: #1519001
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix resource tracker VCPU counting

The resource track is double counting the number of
vcpus used because it counts the virt driver's view
and the resource tracker's view. It should reset
the count to 0 before counting the resourcet racker's
view. this is done for other resources (memory, disk)
in _update_usage_from_instances().

This was not caught in unit tests because they always
provide a virt driver view with no resource used for
tests that assume instances are already running.

This patch adds the reset to 0 and modifies the
tests to provide correct counts of used resources
from the virt driver.

Change-Id: I21acfd7d5b5ed442cd1e9049c986a06bd2b59b81
Closes-Bug: #1519001

important to publish the docs for users and developers. We need to
figure out how to do it (in the community way) and get it done once the
API is stabilized.

commit_message:
Add 'global_project' option for cluster-list

This patch adds an option '-g'/'--global-project' to the 'cluster-list'
command so that an admin user can list clusters from all
tenants/projects.

Change-Id: I9fac64f1e81a6d4e61a93d57a1272d175e8b61e0
Depends-On: Icab38c970de7704c3134afd1b96a03b3670bd2ad

subject: Fix authenticate method in sdk driver
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-24 04:09:05.000000000', 'files': ['senlin/tests/unit/drivers/test_sdk.py', 'senlin/drivers/openstack/sdk.py'], 'message': 'Fix authenticate method in sdk driver

', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix authenticate method in sdk driver

Transport module is removed from pythonopenstacksdk. This patch
revises authenticate method in senlin sdk driver to adopt to this
change.

Note: this is just a workaround before the following patch is in
formal openstacksdk release.

Change-Id: Icae406bada98c21601f7a26d30ad4311f57ea90a

subject: Fix cluster-list api inconsistency
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-23 03:25:28.000000000', 'files': ['senlin/tests/unit/apiv1/test_clusters.py', 'doc/api-site/api-ref/src/wadls/clustering-api/src/v1/clustering-api.wadl', 'senlin/api/openstack/v1/clusters.py', 'senlin/api/openstack/v1/nodes.py'], 'message': "Fix cluster-list api inconsistency

This patch fixes the API parameters for cluster-list call. The
parameters 'project', 'parent', 'user' are removed to be consistent with
node-list API call. We can add these parameters later when requested.
This patch adds real support to 'global_project' for cluster-list, which
was defaulted to 'True' before.

Change-Id: Icab38c970de7704c3134afd1b96a03b3670bd2ad
Closes-Bug: #1465924
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix cluster-list api inconsistency

This patch fixes the API parameters for cluster-list call. The
parameters 'project', 'parent', 'user' are removed to be consistent with
node-list API call. We can add these parameters later when requested.
This patch adds real support to 'global_project' for cluster-list, which
was defaulted to 'True' before.

Change-Id: Icab38c970de7704c3134afd1b96a03b3670bd2ad
Closes-Bug: #1465924

subject: Enable "openstack server resume" command to take multiple servers.
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-23 11:21:54.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/commands.rst', 'doc/source/command-objects/server.rst', 'openstackclient/compute/v2/server.py'], 'message': 'Enable "openstack server resume" command to take multiple servers.

Current "openstack server resume" command could only resume one server.
Improve it to be able to handle more than one servers. Also improve
the doc to reflect the new feature.

Change-Id: I726eb86bfa3df3a9911f45770e6641264dbc1e0b
Implements: blueprint cmd-with-multi-servers
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Enable "openstack server resume" command to take multiple servers.

Current "openstack server resume" command could only resume one server.
Improve it to be able to handle more than one servers. Also improve
the doc to reflect the new feature.

Change-Id: I726eb86bfa3df3a9911f45770e6641264dbc1e0b
Implements: blueprint cmd-with-multi-servers

Implements: blueprint cmd-with-multi-servers
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Enable "openstack server suspend" command to take multiple servers.

Current "openstack server suspend" command could only suspend one server.
Improve it to be able to handle more than one servers. Also improve
the doc to reflect the new feature.

Change-Id: Ic0417ee28f46c9198a35744c0180342e61966b26
Implements: blueprint cmd-with-multi-servers

commit_message:
Convergence: Avoid sync point delete for stack CREATE

Previous traversal sync points should be deleted in case of concurrent
updates. However, in case of stack CREATE there won't be any previous
traversal sync points to delete.
Hence avoid hitting the DB.

Change-Id: If61332107a1f4d70a590f7db87b6c10bc9cf7b2c

commit_message:
fast8: Skip git rm'd files

Don't print error messages trying to diff files
that have been removed via git rm.

Change-Id: Ia0945541208fd7a8362843587f797506000479fc

commit_message:
Using the right format to render the docstring correctly

There are several issues in the docstring, the format is not
correct, not using the full path of class etc.

This patch corrects all of them, so the docstring will be rendered
correctly.

Change-Id: I04d5818f38b5e75b6f6197ef5e13dcd64ed91bf4

commit_message:
Fix error when using keystone v3

Need to use projects instead of tenants and roles instead of
roles_for_user when using keystone v3.

Closes-bug: #1515885

commit_message:
Remove useless LOG definitions

This change removes LOG definition:

  LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__)

in modules not needed it.

Change-Id: I16daae56d8fa5e86a7bb627e7588d0cb60dc552a

commit_message:
Skip senlin_plugin tests until bug #1519185 is fixed.

Senlinclient depends on openstacksdk and new version of
openstacksdk affects senlinclient, so skip senlin_plugin tests
for now until senlinclient fix this problem.

commit_message:
Make sure we return unicode strings for process output

Process output is supposed to be represented with lines, so we should
put Python strings in the queue (not bytes). Just in case, we do it only
for Python 3 environment.

To fix that, we reuse code from utils.execute() linux/windows
implementations.

This fixes the TestAsyncProcess.test_async_process_respawns functional
test for Python 3 environment.

Related-Bug: #1515118
Change-Id: I9efec2290003add44909aab33a0026372a580016

commit_message:
Use Tempest-lib's compute images_client

Compute images_client has been migrated to
tempest-lib- I495915a5a40f7d351cb69463c032281e02c907c7

Now Tempest-lib provides this client as stable interface so Tempest
should start using this from lib and remove its own copy.
Also remove its unit tests.

This commits makes Tempest to use compute images_client
from Tempest-lib.

Change-Id: I4a32fed401251a26081a052f009d9cbee86ed11f

commit_message:
IRR - Implemented for setup-hosts

The change removes and points our role requirements to use
the independent repos that are now online. Updates to the
Ansible bootstrap script here remove the forced "updated"
that was happening on every bootstrap so that we're ensuring
a stable build based on a described version.

Change-Id: If7f83d0875a5b074f506235d650be48a6e461e56
Implements: blueprint independent-role-repositories
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

subject: Update confusing note
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-22 14:05:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Remove confusing note

The note saying that services other than Identity assign meaning to
roles is confusing. I can't figure out what it means. Maybe the
intent was to say that the other services have a policy file that
defines what operations the roles can do. Before the v3 API, keystone
didn't support RBAC, but now with v3 it supports RBAC like all the
other services. Since this note is doesn't add to understanding, remove
it.

commit_message:
Update confusing note

The note saying that services other than Identity assign meaning to
roles is confusing. Maybe the intent was to say that the other services
have a policy file that defines what operations the roles can do.
Before the v3 API, keystone didn't support RBAC, but now with v3 it
supports RBAC like all the other services.

The note is updated so that hopefully it will now provide usable
information.

Change-Id: I9e57c4244f2e57aedc2f0dffbdf38ee07eb67473

commit_message:
Revert "Fix wrong type of exception raised"

This reverts commit c5bb4d2ab83820f5ee2ac3fc6e8d9210e98b26ef.

Every part of this patch was wrong, except that it did (by accident)
start returning 500 errors instead of 400 errors in the case where a
template in the global environment was not found, which is actually the
operator's fault and not the user's. That's not really a serious enough
problem to justify changing it on a stable branch though, so this is a
straight revert. Luckily the patch hasn't made it into a release yet.

Change-Id: Ia3154c7c41bb69cfa2ee36eb6d48fcd339900d60
Closes-Bug: #1518458
Related-Bug: #1447194

commit_message:
Use new version scheme to refer to bsnstacklib

Starting from liberty, date-based versions will no longer be used
for Neutron. This fix changes neutron to use the new version scheme
to refer to bsnstacklib
In an earlier commit, bsnstacklib has been updated to use the new
version scheme. https://review.openstack.org/#/c/217896/

Change-Id: I3ba9e47681700a375508176fa5b3e3a2b170daf5

commit_message:
Rename get_server_group to show_server_group

[GET /resources] methods should be "list_<resource name>s"
or "show_<resource name>", so this patch applies the rule
to server_group client.

This patch makes tempest-lib sync for the commit of Tempest
I75307176c2f032301da6227249070c42af54dd6e, but get_server_group has
been released in tempest-lib 1.0.0 already.
So it is difficult to remove it directly for backwards compatibility
and this patch adds warning message for clarifying deprecated method.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: I9e321aaf4791e8ff11e3aa114b41eb612db481ca

commit_message:
Remove BigSwitch plugin and driver

The BigSwitch Vendor plugin and driver are in
openstack/networking-bigswitch repo and will be moved to
Openstack bigtent. This patch removes the duplicated code and
corresponding entry points. It also moves the bigswitch specific
db tables to openstack/networking-bigswitch.
Closes-Bug: #1508781

', 'number': 6}, {'created': '2015-11-04 18:10:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "python3: converts binary data from channel

in python3 channel can return chunk of binary type.Then next
code tries to join all chunks with stings to result string.

This patchset has reworked algorithm. It converts all received
data to bytes, then joins data, and then converts it to string.
Separate chunks can't be converted to string because they can
contain different parts of one utf-8 char.

Closes-Bug: #1495181
Change-Id: I886c9d0c143d3553876ece7b6d1ac2df7e49d701
", 'number': 7}, {'created': '2015-11-06 08:36:38.000000000', 'files': ['tempest_lib/tests/test_ssh.py', 'tempest_lib/common/ssh.py'], 'message': "python3: converts binary data from channel

paramiko returns chunk of binary type.
So code must join all chunks with binary type and not as str.
Also this patchset adds one more parameter 'encoding' for exec
function to decode binary result to str.

Closes-Bug: #1495181
Change-Id: I886c9d0c143d3553876ece7b6d1ac2df7e49d701
", 'number': 8}]
commit_message:
python3: converts binary data from channel

paramiko returns chunk of binary type.
So code must join all chunks with binary type and not as str.
Also this patchset adds one more parameter 'encoding' for exec
function to decode binary result to str.

Closes-Bug: #1495181
Change-Id: I886c9d0c143d3553876ece7b6d1ac2df7e49d701

Changed "except Exception, e:" to "except Exception as e:" according to
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#python-3-x-compatibility

commit_message:
devref: add upgrade strategy page

The page is intended to describe current upgrade features Neutron
supports, lay out potential improvements, describe testing strategy for
existing and planned upgrade features, and provide guidelines to
reviewers on where to look for potential upgrade breakages in proposed
patches.

Change-Id: I22e55bb2fe32b32d12fa5889b91ecb9f92b3e6a6

commit_message:
Remove unused config option image_alt_ssh_user

It's not used in the code and the corresponding

commit_message:
Move identity wait until after password is updated

With Ied83448de8af1b0da9afdfe6ce9431438215bfe0 merging, we should be waiting
after the password is updated and before we reauthenticate. This change fixes
this to be correct. For some reason a transient failure didn't cause the tests
to fail.

Change-Id: I7286085325c3578958234176adb7588afdcac578
Closes-Bug: 1473567

commit_message:
Fix T110 violations for servers_client

servers_client contained T110 violations, and we need to fix them
before migrating the client to tempest-lib for consistent interfaces.

Change-Id: I10a8c32b53f15063dab087d67123598800b141a0

commit_message:
Add ansible-role-zuul project

In this patch, we are just adding ansible-role-zuul into the OpenStack
gerrit workflow. After talking with both openstack-infra and third
party CI teams it was decided to deal with which team this would be
part of at a later date.

Additionally, we have not created a launchpad project for this module
or pypi (since we won't release there).

Gerritbot was also not configured at this time, since we don't know
which team we are going to be part of.

Change-Id: I6424d66fb644c938e53091da11714e3f782f9a7c
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
