commit_message:
Move get_user_by_username to common part

get_user_by_username of keystone service client is just wrapper method
and it should be moved from the client for implementing it as library.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: Ib44c0b2d085ef2b8f488d804c1c57e078323ce78

the patch fix it.

commit_message:
[V3] Separating groups_client from identity_client

As the qa-spec of consistent-service-method-names, we have decided
all service client modules will be separated into a single module
by each resource. So this patch separates groups_client from
identity_client.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: Iadb49298f41a6307d3b453b365d9b6be31b95781

commit_message:
Option for disabling wait condition feature

It looks like wait condition feature works nice
but there are some issues with that on several deployments.
Added option heat_enable_wait_condition to allow disabling of that.

Closes-bug: 1516784
Change-Id: I082ce0bb4ab8c3c939dcafc2bc821e38c5d760a7

commit_message:
Improve index page layout

Split up draft guides under separate heading and remove draft word for
easier review.

The output looks now basically like:

Generated documents
admin-guide-cloud
contributor-guide
networking-guide
user-guide
user-guide-admin

Draft Guides
arch-design-rst
config-ref-rst
image-guide-rst
install-guide-debian
install-guide-obs
install-guide-rdo
install-guide-ubuntu

Also, create separate tool openstack-indexpage that only generates index
page.

Change-Id: Ic68a674918f18dc37f8b9fa4e9d9f529a8ad131e

commit_message:
Update iLO documentation

This commit fixes the following in iLO documentation:

- Fixes some incorrect information about drivers.
- Fixes some small mistakes like s/Proliant/ProLiant,
  s/nova/Nova, s/baremetal/bare metal, etc.
- Fixes some broken HTTP links and also moves all the
  links inline (removing references like [1], [2], etc)
- Changes a reference of bash ramdisk to agent ramdisk.
- Rebrands HP to HPE. The links are not changed as of now,
  would be updated later once available.

Co-Authored-By: Ramakrishnan G <rameshg87@gmail.com>
Closes-bug: 1511224
Change-Id: I4c065ce0784e73810e9a23390d1148dc13699671

commit_message:
WIP: Increase baremetal active and unprovision timeout to 500s

The new coreos stable images takes little longer to boot and
deploy the os. When used these images results in gate timeout
consistently.

This also may help fix the issue we've been seeing that looks
like TFTP failures. One theory was that slow nodes were taking
too long to provision, but all the timeouts involved seemed
like more than enuogh. However, we totally overlooked this
particular timeout.

Related-Bug: #1393099
Change-Id: I181cd8f02e6612542841f3639a706c27aa902618

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-08-27 07:18:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Copy encryptors from Nova to Cinder

Currently, when creating an encrypted volume from an image, Cinder
writes raw data to the encrypted volume. When Cinder uploads an
encrypted volume to an image, it writes encrypted data to the image.
As a result, Nova cannot use these images or volumes.

To fix above problem, cinder needs to add encryptor attach/detach
layers.
This patch is the first step. It copies encryptors from Nova to
Cinder, and do following changes:
1. Add --dmcypt in end of dev name.
2. Return the new path name in attach_volume().
We can't use Nova encryptors directly as it is also used for local
LVM volumes and remote volumes.

Change-Id: I1669a58cbdf2f7bee390888301c468cbe930b11d
Partial-implements:bp encrypt-volume-with-image
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-09-06 03:49:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Copy encryptors from Nova to Cinder

Currently, when creating an encrypted volume from an image, Cinder

encrypted volume to an image, it writes encrypted data to the image.

commit_message:
Copy encryptors from Nova to Cinder

Currently, when creating an encrypted volume from an image, Cinder
writes raw data to the encrypted volume. When Cinder uploads an
encrypted volume to an image, it writes encrypted data to the image.
As a result, Nova cannot use these images or volumes.

To fix above problem, cinder needs to add encryptor attach/detach
layers.
This patch is the first step. It copies encryptors from Nova to
Cinder, and do following changes:
1. Add --encrypt in end of dev name.
2. Return the new path name in attach_volume().
We can't use Nova encryptors directly as it is also used for local
LVM volumes and remote volumes.

Change-Id: I1669a58cbdf2f7bee390888301c468cbe930b11d
Related-bug: #1482464
Related-bug: #1465656

[{'created': '2015-11-19 09:15:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix skipping `bootstrap_neutron`

`Starting Neutron bootstrap container` task doesn't work due to

", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-11-19 09:47:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Avoid to use `run_once`

Sometimes `Starting * bootstrap container` task doesn't work due to
behavior of `run_once` and `when`.
When `run_once` is used, this task will execute on "the first host",
as defined by inventory, in the group(s) of hosts targeted by the play.

If "the first host" doesn't meet "when" condition, `Starting * bootstrap
container` task will skip.
So we must avoid using with 'run_once' and 'when'.

commit_message:
Avoid to use `run_once`

Sometimes `Starting * bootstrap container` task doesn't work due to
behavior of `run_once` and `when`.
When `run_once` is used, this task will execute on "the first host",
as defined by inventory, in the group(s) of hosts targeted by the
play[1].

If "the first host" doesn't meet "when" condition, `Starting * bootstrap
container` task will skip.
So we must avoid using with 'run_once' and 'when'.

[1]: http://docs.ansible.com/ansible/playbooks_delegation.html#run-once

Change-Id: I8b0a7a643d76793f17445568d1eea86a16485c8d
Closes-Bug: #1517774

commit_message:
Handle glanceclient CommunicationError in horizon

When glanceclient throws a CommunicationError,
Horizon doesn't show the error message from the exception
handling code because the exception type CommunicationError
is not recognized.

This change registers the exception type and
adds a unit test case.

Change-Id: I5c6f3df4097a4493b4c88716f30de86e4cde3b4b
Closes-Bug: #1517652

commit_message:
Extending cluster create tempest test

Extending existing cluster create tempest test to include additional
steps for cue-monitor verification.

The additional steps include:
* Stop the first two nodes in the cluster
* Verify VM's have stopped
* Wait until Cluster status goes to 'DOWN'

Change-Id: I6095b2460e24539bd0d8fd8629bce4b73955ccb1

commit_message:
Split instance details and source in Launch Instance wizard.

Per user feedback, the existing wizard step, Select Source,
is being split into two steps - Instance Details and Select Source.

Partial-Implements: blueprint launch-instance
Change-Id: I3bf2c6dc8baea782416e608965459cce0aee69f6
Co-Authored-By: Coleman Beasley <cbeasley@thoughtworks.com>
Co-Authored-By: Kyle Olivo<keolivo@thoughtworks.com>
Co-Authored-By: Errol Pais<epais@thoughtworks.com>
Co-Authored-By: Matt Borland <matt.borland@hpe.com>

subject: Option to paginate query results
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-12-25 02:09:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Option to paginate query results

The data source tables can potentially contain a huge number of rows. The
client side is unlikely going to be able to handle presenting the entire
results set to the end user without impacting performance. Use pagination to
break up the results.

Also made some indentation and title fixes to existing specs.

Change-Id: I086b23ed18d19c4387adbaaa368bede5aeba7b32
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-01-10 04:40:38.000000000', 'files': ['specs/kilo/server-side-pagination.rst'], 'message': 'Option to paginate query results

The data source tables can potentially contain a huge number of rows. The
client side is unlikely going to be able to handle presenting the entire
results set to the end user without impacting performance. Use pagination to
break up the results.

Change-Id: I086b23ed18d19c4387adbaaa368bede5aeba7b32
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Option to paginate query results

The data source tables can potentially contain a huge number of rows. The
client side is unlikely going to be able to handle presenting the entire
results set to the end user without impacting performance. Use pagination to
break up the results.

Change-Id: I086b23ed18d19c4387adbaaa368bede5aeba7b32

commit_message:
Make the database json variable more readable

Additionally remove tty from the container cleanup docker section. It
was added in a sed in a previous patchset by serves no purpose.

Change-Id: Ib617870616bca687f72ffaa44b2e9a3a11ef1011
Partially-Implements: blueprint cleanup-playbooks

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-18 16:28:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "IPAM: fix 'enable-dhcp' with internal driver

Commit 0c1f96ad5a6606c1205bd50ea944c3a383892cde broke the ipam
internal driver. The base plugin should only call the ipam interface
and not invoke the IPallocation data model.

Closes-bug: #1514810

WIP

Change-Id: I4d7ecb985762a8eef39cb2f22f210b4899f1a22e
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-11-18 16:59:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "IPAM: fix 'enable-dhcp' with internal driver

Commit 0c1f96ad5a6606c1205bd50ea944c3a383892cde broke the ipam
internal driver. The base plugin should only call the ipam interface
and not invoke the IPallocation data model.

Closes-bug: #1514810

Change-Id: I4d7ecb985762a8eef39cb2f22f210b4899f1a22e
", 'number': 2}, {'created': '2015-11-19 07:31:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "IPAM: fix 'enable-dhcp' with internal driver

Commit 0c1f96ad5a6606c1205bd50ea944c3a383892cde broke the ipam
internal driver. The base plugin should only call the ipam interface
and not invoke the IPallocation data model.

Closes-bug: #1514810

Please note that the code is tested following the commit above.

Change-Id: I4d7ecb985762a8eef39cb2f22f210b4899f1a22e
", 'number': 3}, {'created': '2015-11-19 13:04:41.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/db/test_db_base_plugin_v2.py', 'neutron/db/db_base_plugin_v2.py'], 'message': "IPAM: fix 'enable-dhcp' with internal driver

Commit 0c1f96ad5a6606c1205bd50ea944c3a383892cde broke the ipam
internal driver. The base plugin should only call the ipam interface
and not invoke the IPallocation data model.

The code that validated that the subnet had one free IP address was
removed. This would not guarantee that a port would indeed be free,
that is, a parallel operation could have created a port on the subnet
during this check.

Closes-bug: #1514810

commit_message:
IPAM: fix 'enable-dhcp' with internal driver

Commit 0c1f96ad5a6606c1205bd50ea944c3a383892cde broke the ipam
internal driver. The base plugin should only call the ipam interface
and not invoke the IPallocation data model.

The code that validated that the subnet had one free IP address was
removed. This would not guarantee that a port would indeed be free,
that is, a parallel operation could have created a port on the subnet
during this check.

Closes-bug: #1514810

Change-Id: I4d7ecb985762a8eef39cb2f22f210b4899f1a22e

commit_message:
Consolidate the fernet provider issue_v3_token()

When the Fernet token provider was implemented, it extended the
provider.common.py:BaseProvider class. It also overrode most all common methods
the BaseProvider implemented. Other token providers in Keystone (like the UUID
an PKI providers) just implemente a _get_token_id method because token ids may
be different across providers.

This commit removes the issue_v3_token() method from the fernet.Provider. This
ensure that the Fernet provider uses the same issue_v3_token() that all the
other token providers use.

Subsequent patches will do the same for issue_v2_token, validate_v3_token, and
validate_v2_token.

Conflicts:
	keystone/token/providers/fernet/core.py

Closes-Bug: #1515485
Change-Id: I03f56c9c84389a6d6cdb3a6863fcbfca486af337
(cherry picked from commit 91a0b29809cb71c1b2df1642d6c34a3f60a801ed)

commit_message:
Fixed AssertionError for running tests

Since some sentences exceeded a maximum of 79 charaters,
runtests job generated AssertionError during testr like:
'AssertionError: False is not true' and 'Line limited to
a maximum of 79 characters.'

This bug fix is for running tox and for Jenkins test.

Change-Id: I6b7292f49daf57b0ba1c2663df8369a20bde5d3e

commit_message:
Add support for different disk bus

Different disk bus has different device path, so we should change
our way to find device path.

examples:
virtio => virtio-5e7ef7f7-da5b-4b6c-9
scsi => scsi-0QEMU_QEMU_HARDDISK_ab5b3fab-f848-4a00-8
ide => ata-QEMU_HARDDISK_e4bb1070-3ff0-4470-a

I have confirmed with my colleague who is familiar with qemu.
The device path ends with the prefix of the volume id. For example,
when the volume id is e4bb1070-3ff0-4470-ad5a-3edbb30ae011, the ide
device path is ata-QEMU_HARDDISK_e4bb1070-3ff0-4470-a. The last 20
charaters of device path is same as the first 20 charaters of the
volume id. But I can not find any official docs for it now.

Change-Id: I8fc7aa0c0f8722a24f7189c0a8c118dbb724c1d3
Partially-Implements: blueprint support-for-different-volume-type

subject: Allow in-place updates for all compatible types
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-17 21:40:28.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/update.py', 'heat_integrationtests/functional/test_create_update.py', 'heat/engine/resources/template_resource.py', 'heat/engine/resource.py'], 'message': "Allow in-place updates for all compatible types

We previously only allowed a resource to update in-place when the 'type'
field in the old and new templates matched. In an age of environment type
mappings, this is incorrect. Instead, allow a resource to be updated
in-place when the old and new resource plugins are of the same class, since
this is actually what determines whether handle_update is capable of
correctly updating the resource in-place.

There is a special-case for TemplateResource as we currently subclass it
for each template type, but all TemplateResource subclasses are in fact
capable of converting between each other via a stack update.

Change-Id: Iba4abf5efd9737ca6a17d8c91d5c54ab6d3f12e0
Co-Authored-By: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1508115
(cherry picked from commit 98044dbd17c703e6062752f043e1cac6563e3589)
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Allow in-place updates for all compatible types

We previously only allowed a resource to update in-place when the 'type'
field in the old and new templates matched. In an age of environment type
mappings, this is incorrect. Instead, allow a resource to be updated
in-place when the old and new resource plugins are of the same class, since
this is actually what determines whether handle_update is capable of
correctly updating the resource in-place.

There is a special-case for TemplateResource as we currently subclass it
for each template type, but all TemplateResource subclasses are in fact
capable of converting between each other via a stack update.

Change-Id: Iba4abf5efd9737ca6a17d8c91d5c54ab6d3f12e0
Co-Authored-By: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1508115
(cherry picked from commit 98044dbd17c703e6062752f043e1cac6563e3589)

commit_message:
Set "password" as default auth plugin

Currently, when None gets passed through a Connection, None gets sent to
keystoneauth to find the None plugin, which doesn't exist. As "password"
is the likely default, we should send "password" through unless
otherwise specified.

Change-Id: Iafe526d88a1b2ceb8b975f01dddb808f43821f0f

commit_message:
Add find support to BaseProxy

All other actions on the Resource class that are used in Proxy
subclasses had been exposed in BaseProxy except for find. This change
implements a simple `_find` in the base, which brings it in line with
how everything else is done, and is the last piece to get knowledge of
`self.session` out of proxy calls.

Additionally, while moving the proxy implementations to all be the same,
it's a chance to unify the find tests in the proxy. This change
eliminates the need for there to have been two test methods and makes
the tests look like how they're done for every other action.

Change-Id: Ibea01bed4e4ecd76d96021f78db0116012448984
Closes-Bug: 1517149

commit_message:
Changed Stackforge explanation for retirement

Since Stackforge is retiring, two slides: 'What is
Stackforge for' and 'How to add a project to Stackforge'
is not needed for training materials.

Stackforge is currently in migrating status, and
it is used before TC's decision on August 2015,
IMO it is better to keep 'Stackforge' slide.
So some content related to Stackforge was modified
with Stackforge retired and current status.

Change-Id: Ia7026acfde12d129781d90e575bb3caa3d6609aa
Closes-Bug: #1490471

commit_message:
Edit stackviz-export export_tempest_details to save logs

export_tempest_details (responsible for generating the details file in
the stackviz-export process) had strip_details set to True, discarding
all pertinent log info necessary for a full details view. This changes
the strip_details method parameter to the default, False.

Change-Id: I293ccd15e6c0e7b1ba5f7ee9be12584e01d398b6

commit_message:
Fix for min_disk/min_ram in create_image API

If min_disk or min_ram are passed in as keyword arguments, the
values must be integers or glance hates us even more than usual.

commit_message:
Remove shadowed ConnectionError

ConnectionError is redefined later in this module, so the original
ConnectionError isn't visible outside the module. Remove the
original ConnectionError so the code is less confusing.

Change-Id: I4898fbcc5b6300075a30f00d0313df1e4884abce

Partial-Bug: #1505196
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Caches Hyper-V vSwitches

Hyper-V vSwitches are queried for each port that is being bound.
There is no need to query them each time, caching them can
significantly improve performance.

Change-Id: Ibd82775f07d81599fa6d16638af351d2a70f5f4a
Partial-Bug: #1505196

commit_message:
Move validation of compiled unit out of compiler

Instead of having the compiler do any validation on the
graph it has created instead have the compiler just compile
and have the engine that uses that compiled result do any
post compilation validation instead.

This makes it more clear that the compiler just compiles a
flow (and tasks and nested flows) into a graph, and that is
all that it does.

Change-Id: I96a35d732dc2be9fc8bc8dc6466256a19ac2df6d

commit_message:
Allow provided flow to be empty

If someone really wants to provide a flow to run that is
empty that is there prerogative so it doesn't seem that valuable
to blow up if they do this.

Change-Id: I0ad89b0ade85a64f6ec107e2686454ef6dc97353

commit_message:
Pin mime-types gem to 2.6.2 to fix CI

mime-types 3.0 requires mime-types-data gem and ruby>=2.0, which
breaks gate-fuel-library-puppet-lint job.
We can pin mime-types gem to 2.6.2 as a workaround, until
gate-fuel-library-puppet-lint is switched to ruby 2.0 environment

Change-Id: I4ee0514a72821bd6a27a5a0f068107c134e0dc60
Closes-Bug: #1518957
(cherry picked from commit aff0b7f9265480af46d1e87ee20e23a30407e191)

commit_message:
Move get_tenant_by_name to common part

get_tenant_by_name of keystone service client is just wrapper method
and it should be moved from the client for implementing it as library.

subject: Fix a string vs bytes issue in _guess_cgit_link
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-18 16:27:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix a string vs bytes issue in _guess_cgit_link

subprocess.check_output returns bytes, so we end up using '+' on a text
string (CGIT_BASE) and bytes (the output of parsed.path) in
_guess_cgit_link. Use subprocess.getstatusoutput, which returns a text
string.

Change-Id: I9e846e2192ead41ca2328b8aa20994742096c51e
Closes-Bug: #1517525
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-11-19 14:25:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix a string vs bytes issue in _guess_cgit_link

subprocess.check_output returns bytes, so we end up using '+' on a text
string (CGIT_BASE) and bytes (the output of parsed.path) in
_guess_cgit_link. Make sure we decode 'git_remote' in Python 3.

Change-Id: I9e846e2192ead41ca2328b8aa20994742096c51e
Closes-Bug: #1517525
", 'number': 2}, {'created': '2015-11-23 14:06:20.000000000', 'files': ['oslosphinx/__init__.py'], 'message': "Fix a string vs bytes issue in _guess_cgit_link

subprocess.check_output returns bytes, so we end up using '+' on a text
string (CGIT_BASE) and bytes (the output of parsed.path) in
_guess_cgit_link. Make sure we decode 'git_remote' in Python 3.

Change-Id: I9e846e2192ead41ca2328b8aa20994742096c51e
Closes-Bug: #1517525
", 'number': 3}]
commit_message:
Fix a string vs bytes issue in _guess_cgit_link

subprocess.check_output returns bytes, so we end up using '+' on a text
string (CGIT_BASE) and bytes (the output of parsed.path) in
_guess_cgit_link. Make sure we decode 'git_remote' in Python 3.

Change-Id: I9e846e2192ead41ca2328b8aa20994742096c51e
Closes-Bug: #1517525

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-08 16:50:53.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_protection.py', 'etc/policy.v3cloudsample.json'], 'message': 'Fix for listing role assignments by project admin

Project admin fails to list role assignments for his project with
Project Scoped Token.
The issue is project admin in default policy file
(policy.v3cloudsample.json) does not have access to get details
of his project. Due to this, keystone assumes that the project
does not exist, and tries to get the project listing which again
fails.
This change updates the default policy file to let project
administrators to retrieve their own project details.

Change-Id: I025a94d23b7e4eb0a2bffd1db6da92496783264f
Closes-Bug: 1418702
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix for listing role assignments by project admin

Project admin fails to list role assignments for his project with
Project Scoped Token.
The issue is project admin in default policy file
(policy.v3cloudsample.json) does not have access to get details
of his project. Due to this, keystone assumes that the project
does not exist, and tries to get the project listing which again
fails.
This change updates the default policy file to let project
administrators to retrieve their own project details.

Change-Id: I025a94d23b7e4eb0a2bffd1db6da92496783264f
Closes-Bug: 1418702

subject: Sample environment with old ServiceNetMap value
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-23 18:08:26.000000000', 'files': ['environments/updates/update-from-keystone-admin-internal-api.yaml', 'environments/updates/README.md'], 'message': "Sample environment with old ServiceNetMap value

The original value for the ServiceNetMap parameter had the Keystone
Admin API service on the Internal API network. Later, it was moved to
the ctlplane network by default.

Users updating from clouds already deployed may not want to have the
service moved, and we've occassionly seen it cause issues with services
not getting restarted properly.

This sample environment file documents the old value so that users can
just optionally include it via -e to keep the services the same as they
were when they originally deployed.

Change-Id: I0b68542337a2f40e26df15fe7ac2da5aafe651d5
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Sample environment with old ServiceNetMap value

The original value for the ServiceNetMap parameter had the Keystone
Admin API service on the Internal API network. Later, it was moved to
the ctlplane network by default.

Users updating from clouds already deployed may not want to have the
service moved, and we've occassionly seen it cause issues with services
not getting restarted properly.

This sample environment file documents the old value so that users can
just optionally include it via -e to keep the services the same as they
were when they originally deployed.

Change-Id: I0b68542337a2f40e26df15fe7ac2da5aafe651d5

subject: Clean up legacy multi-version test constructs
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-23 18:32:00.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/objects/test_objects.py'], 'message': "Clean up legacy multi-version test constructs

This removes MyObj2 and MyObjDiffVers from the tests, and fixes up the
tests that still use them to use the more modern manifest-based approach,
which is much cleaner and doesn't require strangely subclassed objects
to mimic the multi-version environment during an upgrade.

It also removes a few tests that still do some basic validation on the
object registry, which is now fully contained (and tested) inside of
oslo.versionedobjects.

Conflicts:
	nova/tests/unit/objects/test_objects.py

Change-Id: Ia523f3264b0ea54573e54c258efd7a07158ded36
Depends-On: Icbbb78cfcd074b0050e60c54557637af723f9b92
(cherry picked from commit 8cc7c938955dc5e5b1d2f75b249738a499aa5d79)
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Clean up legacy multi-version test constructs

This removes MyObj2 and MyObjDiffVers from the tests, and fixes up the
tests that still use them to use the more modern manifest-based approach,
which is much cleaner and doesn't require strangely subclassed objects
to mimic the multi-version environment during an upgrade.

It also removes a few tests that still do some basic validation on the
object registry, which is now fully contained (and tested) inside of
oslo.versionedobjects.

Conflicts:
	nova/tests/unit/objects/test_objects.py

Change-Id: Ia523f3264b0ea54573e54c258efd7a07158ded36
Depends-On: Icbbb78cfcd074b0050e60c54557637af723f9b92
(cherry picked from commit 8cc7c938955dc5e5b1d2f75b249738a499aa5d79)

commit_message:
Fix the end point test for client

Due to recent change in neutronclient the endpoint value got changes
in following patch.

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/236325/

This patch will test both public or publicURL endpoints.

Change-Id: I0dffb06c5151203e9fe2ab041a7beb028a39aac0
Closes-bug: #1517579

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-03 02:30:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix duplicate meter samples

In ceilometer.conf, when configured notification_topics with more than
one value, as the listeners listen all the topics, so it causes
duplicate meter samples. Here if only one messaging_url exists, let the
listener only listen "notification" topic. if want to listen another
topic, need to configure another messaging_url.

Change-Id: I7af36f8e7615ccc31ffad94169b4e5ce1f9df84f

commit_message:
Clarify the doc about multiple notification_topics usage

Make clear that the multiple notification topic usage in ceilometer.conf
in case of mistakenly configured that cause duplicate samples.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1496777
Change-Id: I7af36f8e7615ccc31ffad94169b4e5ce1f9df84f

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-23 17:43:00.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/cinder/tasks/bootstrap.yml', 'ansible/roles/ironic/tasks/bootstrap.yml', 'ansible/roles/neutron/tasks/bootstrap.yml', 'ansible/roles/nova/tasks/bootstrap.yml', 'ansible/roles/murano/tasks/bootstrap.yml', 'ansible/roles/heat/tasks/bootstrap.yml', 'ansible/roles/keystone/tasks/bootstrap.yml', 'ansible/roles/glance/tasks/bootstrap.yml'], 'message': 'Incorrect parsed variable name

database_user_create was not correctly referenced when parsing the
variable names. This could never actually lead to a situation that
reported a false change, but it could break an operation if you were
using the --step option with ansible and skipped the database create
task.

TrivialFix
Backport: Liberty

Partial-Bug: #1519040
Change-Id: Idf69fffcc3814f509448ccea11b7d175f074ccf1
(cherry picked from commit 6b283430173caf0d0ecabce55dfa62abfe68787a)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Incorrect parsed variable name

database_user_create was not correctly referenced when parsing the
variable names. This could never actually lead to a situation that
reported a false change, but it could break an operation if you were
using the --step option with ansible and skipped the database create
task.

TrivialFix
Backport: Liberty

Partial-Bug: #1519040
Change-Id: Idf69fffcc3814f509448ccea11b7d175f074ccf1
(cherry picked from commit 6b283430173caf0d0ecabce55dfa62abfe68787a)

commit_message:
[install] Fix the Debian nova-compute node install

This patch fixes numerous issues in the nova-compute setup in Debian.
This is a 2nd attempt after the patch was reverted. Hopefuly, this
patch wont have issues with conditionals this time.

Change-Id: I03eedb6e6262e2a0484814a953a5787aca7b5624

commit_message:
Adding support for error details on cluster creation

Cue's current implementation does not provide any additional information
to the user related to why a cluster went into ERROR state during
cluster creation.  This patch adds error_detail field in the
clusters table and exposes this field through the API.  The
update_cluster_task now extracts failure flow details and forwards this
information on cluster record update.

Partial-Bug:  1508730
(updates also required to Cue client and dashboard)
Closes-bug:  1516735
Change-Id: I440fec30bc3d051189585479b8d2c1219a98cf40

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-20 16:06:52.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/conductor/manager.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/conductor/test_manager.py'], 'message': 'Fix: Next cleaning hangs if the previous cleaning was aborted

When cleaning is abort Ironic leaves the node's clean_step field
populated with the step that was running at the moment. Because of that,
once the next cleaning starts again (after the node have been moved to
"manageable" and in the transition to "available") it will hang and
never finish, the reason for that is because once the node starts
heartbeating again Ironic won't know if the cleaning just started or
it's just continuing cleaning (it uses clean_step as a flag for it,
see the bug linked with this patch).

This patch fix this by cleaning up the node's clean_field once the
cleaning process is aborted.

Closes-Bug: #1518374
Change-Id: I423e89f9574a8952875ad9f03ce33298cb5660e7
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix: Next cleaning hangs if the previous cleaning was aborted

When cleaning is abort Ironic leaves the node's clean_step field
populated with the step that was running at the moment. Because of that,
once the next cleaning starts again (after the node have been moved to
"manageable" and in the transition to "available") it will hang and
never finish, the reason for that is because once the node starts
heartbeating again Ironic won't know if the cleaning just started or
it's just continuing cleaning (it uses clean_step as a flag for it,
see the bug linked with this patch).

This patch fix this by cleaning up the node's clean_field once the
cleaning process is aborted.

Closes-Bug: #1518374
Change-Id: I423e89f9574a8952875ad9f03ce33298cb5660e7

[{'created': '2015-11-16 17:58:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add clean up method for the DHCP factory

The DHCP provider base class has only update methods to notify the
provider which DHCP BOOT options to reserve when a node comes up. If anyone
wants to create his own DHCP provider implementation for Ironic, none of
the base class methods get triggered after a node is deleted, so the DHCP
reservations will be present even after the Ironic node is deleted.

This patch adds a 'clean_dhcp' method to the DHCPFactory class, which is used
to clean the DHCP BOOT options when an Ironic node is deleted. This is called
when an Ironic node is deleted.

commit_message:
Add clean up method for the DHCP factory

The DHCP provider base class has only update methods to notify the
provider which DHCP BOOT options to reserve when a node comes up. If anyone
wants to create his own DHCP provider implementation for Ironic, none of
the base class methods get triggered after a node is deleted, so the DHCP
reservations will be present even after the Ironic node is deleted.

This patch adds a 'clean_dhcp' method to the DHCPFactory class, which is used
to clean the DHCP BOOT options. This is called when an Ironic node is torn down.

Closes-Bug: #1498923
Change-Id: Iec768268323204b39fa80731e22a2511c7ac7763

commit_message:
Resolve issue where router can't be removed from L3-agent in dvr mode

Fixes the problem where the L3 DVR Scheduler is unable
to remove a DVR router from a L3 agent running in
'dvr' mode.

Closes-bug: 1489091
Change-Id: Id128a81d2cf7108936715ee305012fbff23ffdbf
(cherry picked from commit 3de01b39b74d0a23f765b1f9b1a4ba1eb457068c)

commit_message:
Fixed Update Metadata modal description's typos

There were typos in the Update Metadata modal description.
"In the left columns..." is clearly a typo, which should be
"In the left column..." Also, in the bug report there is another
issue: "Other" option should be "Custom".

Change-Id: If4a82109aaa4f1ba18e1415af0ff197658abda2f
Closes-Bug: #1517296

commit_message:
Implement Advanced Firewalling support

Consume puppet-tripleo to create/manage IPtables from Heat templates.

This review put in place the logic to enable and setup firewall rules.

A known set of rules are applied. More to come.

Change-Id: Ib79c23fb27fe3fc03bf223e6922d896cb33dad22
Co-Authored-By: Yanis Guenane <yguenane@redhat.com>
Depends-On: I144c60db2a568a94dce5b51257f1d10980173325

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-09-29 11:16:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "libvirt: Log warning for wrong migration flag config options

The config options live_migration_flag and block_migration_flag
of the [libvirt] section set the flags for the hypervisor for the
live-migration operation. It is possible to set the flags in a way
that every live-migration will be a block-migration and vice versa.
This doesn't make sense and is a misconfiguration.

Because some customers could already have configured their systems in
this faulty way, this patch set logs a warning if it discovers this,
instead of blocking the nova-compute service to come up.

Closes-Bug: #1499041
Change-Id: I37f1e90c8a86a1dcf0fc1e699a018e0784c66e48

commit_message:
libvirt: Log warning for wrong migration flag config options

The config options live_migration_flag and block_migration_flag
of the [libvirt] section set the flags for the hypervisor for the
live-migration operation. It is possible to set the flags in a way
that every live-migration will be a block-migration and vice versa.
This doesn't make sense and is a misconfiguration.

Because some customers could already have configured their systems in
this faulty way, this patch set logs a warning if it discovers this,
instead of blocking the nova-compute service to come up.

Closes-Bug: #1499041
Change-Id: I37f1e90c8a86a1dcf0fc1e699a018e0784c66e48

commit_message:
Remove self from image-create/image-update

Self is not meant to exist as it is a READ ONLY property, that is not
meant to exist as something the user can change.

Closes-bug: 1496024
Change-Id: I28fd51a4cbef40fc7c90999fe8121611c7f89f21

commit_message:
Cause forbidden when deactivating image(non-admin)

If a user tries to deactivate an image that is hosted by the admin that
has public visiblity, it will currently return a 500 error. This changes
that behaviour to return a Forbidden.

Closes-Bug: 1485940
Change-Id: Id7f645fc599e57f6c0842bba2b7a2f3db52784ae

commit_message:
Create openstack-infra/log_processor project

Create a project for the python files currently managed in
openstack-infra/puppet-log_processor. These scripts have grown to the
point were they should be made a proper python module. The scripts have
been copied to github.com/jesusaurus/log_processor preserving git
history using git-filter-branch.

Change-Id: I365e9272101f87761533169700193e6d19d2741a

commit_message:
Remove hardcoded LDAP group schema from emulated enabled mix-in

The emulated enabled mix-in uses hard-coded LDAP schema for the
group objectclass and membership attributes.  This patch makes the
mix-in optionally use the LDAP group configuration settings.

Change-Id: I5ed9d552ec140f83578398fd29e2130ebf827662
Closes-Bug: #1515302
(cherry picked from commit e465de5b44ffb1da65eab77ba7c81d1c0ced367f)

commit_message:
Moved node list to default application state

Rather than having a placeholder as the main view of
the application, we've moved the node list to the root
of the application. This brings the primary resource
for ironic to the forefront and immediately gives the
user something to do.

Change-Id: I6aaca2af1acd0ddeac58f1295438e64d45afaad2

commit_message:
Introduced Root State

The introduction of a root state permits us to move the overall
application layout to a location that is common to the entire
application. It reduces template duplication, and allows us
to specifically target view containers at any level of the
ui framework.

The ApplicationController has been renamed to describe its
new function, and a new 'main.html' template was added.
Note that there are quite a few whitespace changes, as
the indentation of many files changed when the encapsulating
div container moved to the global template.

Change-Id: I2d0b7147903f0af0560cd33903a1e6e4df309f55

commit_message:
Dynamically reconfiguring resources

This patch makes use of the new $$configuration provider,
the $$selectedConfiguration provider, and the $resourceCache,
to allow hot-swapping the current API without having to reload
the page. It also splits these resources out of the module.js file
into individual files (one file per thing best practice), adds tests,
and updates the coverage threshold accordingly.

The old resource factory method has been removed, as individual
service definitions have been pushed into the services themselves.
This gives them greater control over which actions they expose,
and what URL's those actions map to.

An edge case was identified which, due to the asynchronous
nature of configuration loading, could result in an API
request being issued while the selected configuration is either
invalid or not yet available. For this purpose a $$dummyResource
provider was added, so that the system does not throw
unexpected errors.

Change-Id: I7f6542631266d481e5b847a7e4b9d08057801ba8

commit_message:
Report stack_status_reason on heat failure

When stack create fails, report the status reason, instead
of just the status. This gives the user useful information about
the cause of the failure (out of floating IPs, etc.) instead of
just "CREATE_FAILED".

Change-Id: Ibbaf14e8959cecfade98d13f8101e333eb76ee6e
Closes-Bug: 1516016
(cherry picked from commit dec8f7ab922c2ab454afe9c58842650ba701a2cc)

commit_message:
Set logging level same as other fuel services

Astute was the only fuel service using short ERR and CRIT log levels,
it led to unconvinient log viewing using the WebUI.

Change-Id: I3dd8e7d80030f6a16d910ee28950102b31765af5
Closes-bug: #1286110

commit_message:
Made Decision Engine extensible via stevedore

The objective for this is to give the ability to extend the default
set of placement algorithms (i.e. strategies) currently available
in Watcher using Stevedore.

Now, you can add your new strategy as an entry point under the
'[watcher_strategies]' section.

Change-Id: I4aecf629015e41b0389d07e47220333e50bbbe1a

commit_message:
status in os-server-external-events is optional

os-server-external-events's status request param is optional
and default to 'completed'

Partial-Bug: #1515222

commit_message:
Add response params for GET image members

This commit adds following params into response parameter for
GET v2/images{image_id}/members:
  * members
  * created_at
  * image_id
  * member_id
  * status
  * updated_at
  * schema(member)

Change-Id: Iad31516e70f4ae2ab4f2a82eea79042b6ab453a3
Closes-Bug: #1518880

', 'number': 7}, {'created': '2015-06-10 02:06:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add guideline for microversion specification

This specification is reference to Nova and Ironic API Microversion implementation:
https://github.com/openstack/nova-specs/blob/master/specs/kilo/implemented/api-microversions.rst
https://github.com/openstack/ironic-specs/blob/master/specs/kilo/api-microversions.rst

The difference between Nova and Ironic implementation is Ironic return minimum and maximum
version by HTTP Headers all the time. This specification adds those two headers also for
backward compatible with Ironic implementation.

But for the error response, the error info should be in the response body, not headers.
So this specification adds description of response body also. And the response body is
backward compatible with existed implementation also.

Change-Id: Ie10b8cf78fab43f437ae3ec7adb7f243de0505af

commit_message:
Add introduction for API microversion guideline

This specification is reference to Nova and Ironic API
microversion implementation:
https://github.com/openstack/nova-specs/blob/master/specs/kilo/implemented/api-microversions.rst
https://github.com/openstack/ironic-specs/blob/master/specs/kilo/api-microversions.rst

Current API microversion is different from common versioning SemVer,
so it is nice to go forward with small steps for bulding a consensus.

Change-Id: Ie10b8cf78fab43f437ae3ec7adb7f243de0505af

commit_message:
A guideline for errors

Errors are a crucial part of the developer experience when using an API. As
developers learn the API they inevitably run into errors. The quality and
consistency of the error messages returned to them will play a large part
in how quickly they can learn the API, how they can be more effective with
the API, and how much they enjoy using the API.

We need consistency across all services for the error format returned in
the response body.

Change-Id: Iae6dc4d84c11c95a97d2451668ebffa80c9821ec

commit_message:
Reverse sort tables before archiving

sqlalchemy metadata provides a way to sort tables based on foreign
key dependency relationships and then we can reverse sort those to
process leaf nodes first when archiving deleted records. Use this
to at least attempt to archive things in a sane order.

Adds a functional test to cover this since the unit tests for archive
are setup in such a way that they don't stress many of the tables
related to a created instance record and thus miss some fundamental
referential constraint failures during archive.

This does not completely fix archive_deleted_rows because of the issue
with instance_actions not being soft deleted when instances are deleted,
which we still need to sort out, but this at least gives us a functional
test that stresses a real usage of the DB API. And since the tables are
now sorted we can reliably assert the archive results.

Partial-Bug: #1183523

Change-Id: I948b149239f01cca2d4156611bb883580a216a83

This removes MyObj2 and MyObjDiffVers from the tests, and fixes up the
tests that still use them to use the more modern manifest-based approach,
which is much cleaner and doesn't require strangely subclassed objects
to mimic the multi-version environment during an upgrade.

It also removes a few tests that still do some basic validation on the

Change-Id: Ia523f3264b0ea54573e54c258efd7a07158ded36

commit_message:
Clean up legacy multi-version test constructs

This removes MyObj2 and MyObjDiffVers from the tests, and fixes up the
tests that still use them to use the more modern manifest-based approach,
which is much cleaner and doesn't require strangely subclassed objects
to mimic the multi-version environment during an upgrade.

It also removes a few tests that still do some basic validation on the
object registry, which is now fully contained (and tested) inside of
oslo.versionedobjects.

Change-Id: Ia523f3264b0ea54573e54c258efd7a07158ded36

commit_message:
Mark set-admin-password as complete for libvirt in support matrix

The set-admin-password virt driver API was implemented for libvirt
qemu/kvm x86 in liberty per 520a6b92853cf0f6ef183df78c41c70ee0b8cfab but
the hypervisor support matrix wasn't updated.

This updates the support matrix and also adds notes that libvirt 1.2.16
is required along with hw_qemu_guest_agent configuration in the backing
image.

Closes-Bug: #1511114

Change-Id: Iee1d628116cad8c0c60c8335a2910b3c4e1b5e2d

commit_message:
Use idp_id and protocol_id in jsonhome

These are inconsistent with the rest of the federation routes. Note that
this doesn't change a public interface, it changes the path variables
names that exist within a jsonhome document which should only be
referenced within the same href_vars element and some internal variable
names.

Change-Id: I36d41e95d745bd98d36c3442bd4aa4faa91cab72
Closes-Bug: #1420125

subject: Data Security Enforcements In Nova
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-02 22:16:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Data Security Enforcements In Nova

Enterprises need to be compliant with data security laws and regulations that
require sensitive data to be encrypted at rest (storage) as well in motion
(over the wire). Nova has features such as transparent data encryption that
can be utilized as part of a data security compliance plan. We propose
implementing checks inside Nova that will ensure that such features are
enabled. These checks will be triggered based on the presence of specific
metadata defined on an image. Such declaration based enforcements can provide
additional confidence to the operators tasked with setting up a secure cloud
and thereby provide impetus to the enterprise adoption of OpenStack.

Change-Id: I0618bf381d1868af7facf991d22e2e8113794193
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-10-03 00:13:58.000000000', 'files': ['specs/mitaka/approved/data-security-enforcements.rst'], 'message': 'Data Security Enforcements In Nova

Enterprises need to be compliant with data security laws and regulations that
require sensitive data to be encrypted at rest (storage) as well in motion
(over the wire). Nova has features such as transparent data encryption that
can be utilized as part of a data security compliance plan. We propose
implementing checks inside Nova that will ensure that such features are
enabled. These checks will be triggered based on the presence of specific
metadata defined on an image. Such declaration based enforcements can provide
additional confidence to the operators tasked with setting up a secure cloud
and thereby provide impetus to the enterprise adoption of OpenStack.

Change-Id: I0618bf381d1868af7facf991d22e2e8113794193
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Data Security Enforcements In Nova

Enterprises need to be compliant with data security laws and regulations that
require sensitive data to be encrypted at rest (storage) as well in motion
(over the wire). Nova has features such as transparent data encryption that
can be utilized as part of a data security compliance plan. We propose
implementing checks inside Nova that will ensure that such features are
enabled. These checks will be triggered based on the presence of specific
metadata defined on an image. Such declaration based enforcements can provide
additional confidence to the operators tasked with setting up a secure cloud
and thereby provide impetus to the enterprise adoption of OpenStack.

Change-Id: I0618bf381d1868af7facf991d22e2e8113794193

subject: Improve support for REMOTE_OPERATIONS in manual runs
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-06-04 15:58:16.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/create-nodes', 'scripts/install-dependencies', 'scripts/setup-network', 'scripts/configure-vm', 'scripts/get-vm-mac', 'scripts/boot-seed-vm', 'scripts/setup-seed-vm'], 'message': 'Improve support for REMOTE_OPERATIONS in manual runs

This submission applies a number of small changes which made me
to complete successully the build of a seed VM using the
REMOTE_OPERATIONS parameter set to "1" (that is, devtest running
on a distinct host with remote access to libvirtd).

A few notes about the changes:
 * uniforms checks for REMOTE_OPERATIONS using -n rather than != 1
 * removes occurrences of 'sudo virsh' which would not honour the
   user (devtest) defined LIBVIRT_DEFAULT_URI parameter
 * skips chattr +C when images are not available locally

Change-Id: Ib2ce2926fe02a0f5f370a81495cfc192db8b3427
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Improve support for REMOTE_OPERATIONS in manual runs

This submission applies a number of small changes which made me
to complete successully the build of a seed VM using the
REMOTE_OPERATIONS parameter set to "1" (that is, devtest running
on a distinct host with remote access to libvirtd).

A few notes about the changes:
 * uniforms checks for REMOTE_OPERATIONS using -n rather than != 1
 * removes occurrences of 'sudo virsh' which would not honour the
   user (devtest) defined LIBVIRT_DEFAULT_URI parameter
 * skips chattr +C when images are not available locally

Change-Id: Ib2ce2926fe02a0f5f370a81495cfc192db8b3427

commit_message:
Do not pass public to keystone.initialize

In os-cloud-config public is preferred to host if passed so this
change avoids us passing public.

Change-Id: I1d324af84a070753185a104924afec8e0ffb1155

commit_message:
Remove file locks from drivers to support HA A/A

This spec outlines work needed for volume nodes to remove local file
locks from Storage Drivers so syncrhonization is possible among Volume
nodes.

This is one of the aspects that are needed to support Active/Active in
cinder.

Implements: blueprint cinder-volume-active-active-support
Change-Id: I3b94d3bce4c61a344cac073f5f0eafc5a70d233f

commit_message:
Catch exception raised by keystoneauth1

We must support session object that comes from keystoneauth1 and
keystoneclient.

This change adds code path for keystoneauth1 when it misses.

Change-Id: I1164a0a0745605b6bc4fd1fc8fb2813c7e40fb9b

commit_message:
Allow building prepared images for Ironic

Sahara-image-elements should be able to build prepared
images for Ironic. Per documentation [1], we should include
several elements during image building.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/ironic/deploy/install-guide.html#image-requirements
Change-Id: Id1d4335230b24e4fc4c46b60c70ddd9bae6ea217

commit_message:
Use standard credential_id parameter in jsonhome

The EC2 jsonhome credential_id is referenced as a parameter unique to
EC2. This is actually just the standard credential_id parameter that
keystone core uses.

Change-Id: I588d2af27116562039dae9d1c51cc877e74d5e9c

', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-11-18 13:44:00.000000000', 'files': ['functionaltests/common/client.py', 'contrib/devstack/run_tempest_tests.sh'], 'message': "Disable DevStack/Tempest runs

commit_message:
Disable DevStack/Tempest runs

Some config options were renamed in tempest, which our Kilo
devstack/tempest code relies on. Update these to the new
names, but that's still not enough. Disable these tests
on Kilo until we can figure this out.

Change-Id: I41f30ab24bffa60444f2cd42dc15c583edc91953

commit_message:
WIP: Add update environment directory and sample file

This change adds an 'update' directory within 'environments' were we
can store additional environment files to be optionally used for an
update.

Also adds an initial 'update-from-vip.yaml' and a README.md file
documenting when is appropriate to use it.

Change-Id: Ic28286f5d699d89de943585f5bc910eb91b7d573

subject: Python3-readiness for antlr3 pieces
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-06 02:07:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Python3-readiness for antlr3 pieces

Purpose: Make antlr code Python3-ready while keeping Python2 support

Changes:
- Generated Python3 CongressParser.py and CongressLexer.py placed in
subpackage congress/datalog/Python3/ (using antlr 3.5.2)
- Moved original CongressParser.py and CongressLexer.py into new
subpackage congress/datalog/Python2/
- Changed import section in congress/datalog/compiler.py to import
the appropriate subpackage based on python version used
- Removed original symlink antlr3 to the antlr3-python2 runtime
- Changed setup.py to create the appropriate antlr3 symlink based on
python version
- Changed the error reporting interface of antlr3-python3 runtime to
be compatible with what existing Congress code expects
(thirdparty/antlr3-antlr-3.5/runtime/Python3/antlr3/recognizers.py)

Result: tox -e py34 no longer reports any errors traced to antlr code.

Notes:
- Supporting both Python versions was not straightforward because
neither the antlr runtime nor the antlr generated code is
cross-version compatible.
- Making symlinks via setup.py is not ideal, but the best solution
I came up with among several I considered. If you have better ideas
please suggest.
- Making our own custom changes to antlr3-python3 runtime is not
ideal, but it was necessary because for some reason the
antlr3-python3 runtime broke error reporting interface compatibility
with antlr3-python2 runtime, leading to test failures in
test_compile.py and test_congress.py.
In theory, supporting our custom changes in antlr3 runtime bad, but
because antlr3 is not supported anyway, the situation is really no
worse than before. In addition, the changes are fairly minor.
- antlr4 was not adopted because it does not have support for
abstract syntax trees.

Change-Id: I376aee803c4dc9953c1b5ba9311cf9c4a42f3319

commit_message:
Python3-readiness for antlr3 pieces

Purpose: Make antlr code Python3-ready while keeping Python2 support

Changes:
- Generated Python3 CongressParser.py and CongressLexer.py placed in
subpackage congress/datalog/Python3/ (using antlr 3.5.2)
- Moved original CongressParser.py and CongressLexer.py into new
subpackage congress/datalog/Python2/
- Changed import section in congress/datalog/compiler.py to import
the appropriate subpackage based on python version used
- Removed original symlink antlr3 to the antlr3-python2 runtime
- Changed setup.py to create the appropriate antlr3 symlink based on
python version
- Changed the error reporting interface of antlr3-python3 runtime to
be compatible with what existing Congress code expects
(thirdparty/antlr3-antlr-3.5/runtime/Python3/antlr3/recognizers.py)

Result: tox -e py34 no longer reports any errors traced to antlr code.

Notes:
- Supporting both Python versions was not straightforward because
neither the antlr runtime nor the antlr generated code is
cross-version compatible.
- Making symlinks via setup.py is not ideal, but the best solution
I came up with among several I considered. If you have better ideas
please suggest.
- Making our own custom changes to antlr3-python3 runtime is not
ideal, but it was necessary because for some reason the
antlr3-python3 runtime broke error reporting interface compatibility
with antlr3-python2 runtime, leading to test failures in
test_compile.py and test_congress.py.
In theory, supporting our custom changes in antlr3 runtime bad, but
because antlr3 is not supported anyway, the situation is really no
worse than before. In addition, the changes are fairly minor.
- antlr4 was not adopted because it does not have support for
abstract syntax trees.

Partially implements blueprint: support-python3

Change-Id: I376aee803c4dc9953c1b5ba9311cf9c4a42f3319

Remove Python 2.6 classifier

removes Python 2.6 classifier before dropping any Python
2.6 support in code.

commit_message:
Windows Scheduler

freezer runs the scheduler as a windows service
the service is divided in two parts:
    win_daemon, which interacts with freezer-api and freezer-agent
    win_service, which install freezer scheduler

Change-Id: I148105a7efd3cead6817cbc2dab255451fb3b9a4

commit_message:
Fail when Neutron calls limits APIs.

According to http://docs.openstack.org/developer/nova/project_scope.html?highlight=proxy#no-more-api-proxies,
Nova APIs shouldn't be used a proxies for in other openstack services.  This fix
raises an HTTPBadRequest (400) exception if Neutron calls the UsedLimits or Limits APIs.

Change-Id: I821aa0a3975f2be879851e9cb556cd6de24e7170
Closes-Bug: #1186354

commit_message:
Note that BandwidthUsage relates to Instance

It's not obvious (at least I completely missed it) that the uuid field
on BandwidthUsage is a reference to an instance uuid. Renaming the field
instance_uuid would be nice but a lot of work for little benefit, so
let's just put a comment.

Change-Id: I5d5b009f6da9e6c3e176be7cb62c363235978b63

commit_message:
neutron-db-manage: mark several options as deprecated

I believe we don't rely on --core_plugin or --quota_driver for the tool
because database contents are independent of chosen plugins and drivers
since ~Juno.

Also marked --service with deprecated_for_removal=True.

Related-Bug: #1501380
Change-Id: I2b4d98242a0d38843d931a71414ef2560a7ddb8f

This patch modifies mistral::db::sync so that it
runs 'update head' instead of 'populate'. We
will likely want to create a new module called
mistral::db::populate that runs just the populate
command.

This brings the mistral "db_sync" class more inline
with other Puppet Openstack modules that run DB sync
and fixes issues in bootstrapping mistral in that
running populate without first having an 'upgrade head'

commit_message:
Update mistral::db::sync to run 'update head'

This patch modifies mistral::db::sync so that it
runs 'update head' instead of 'populate'. We
will likely want to create a new module called
mistral::db::populate that runs just the populate
command.

This brings the mistral "db_sync" class more inline
with other Puppet Openstack modules that run DB sync
and fixes issues in bootstrapping mistral in that
running populate without first having an 'upgrade head'
would always fail.

Change-Id: I9aa02fa8ba2c42aa830c8b0eb556e769b45013f4

subject: Integration of Ceilometer in Watcher
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-17 18:05:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Integration of Ceilometer in Watcher

In current implementation is not easy to use ceilometer.

commit_message:
Integration of Ceilometer in Watcher

In current implementation is not easy to use ceilometer.
Watcher must query metrics from the Telemetry v2 API to allow an easiest integration with OpenStack components (especially devstack).

blueprint telemetry-integration
Change-Id: Ide515472f1d160925d9f4aabf48c96dea4f6bc05

commit_message:
Make VPN functional jobs voting

Now that the VPN functional jobs running with the new job template have been
running non-voting, we can re-add the jobs to the gate queue and make them
voting.

Verified that the jobs, using the new template, ran with a Neutron commit,
using experimental job (see review 242222/6).

Later, based on community decision, the VPN functional job for StrongSwan
can be moved from Neutron experimental queue, to a voting queue.

Change-Id: I809ef7e61eaddcbfd11c26b218c784622f588c1d
Partial-Bug: 1495584

commit_message:
Split abandon into pre-abandon(export) and abandon

Splits the existing abandon action into two actions as
below:
1. export: User is recommended to run export successfully
   before doing the abandon action. It returns the stack
   data, which can be used for adopting stack.
2. abandon: Abandons the given stack

Partial-Bug: #1353670

Co-Authored-By: Jason Dunsmore <jasondunsmore@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I65264d91b1378df9cb3e492bc6ccaa778940dd6b

subject: Ignore KeyError for secret field
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-23 03:02:06.000000000', 'files': ['congress/managers/datasource.py'], 'message': "Ignore KeyError for secret field

Although it doesn't make sense to create a datasource without
providing auth info in config info, it may be not possible to
define a schema to verify because different datasource drivers
may use different kinds of auth methods. So we should be able
to handle the case that none secret info is provided. The fix
just simply ignores KeyError exception here.

Change-Id: I06bc6a4fb659d862da96dd96557454b6385d003f
Closes-Bug: #1492354
(cherry picked from commit 22210a9ee65526ca0ccaf448260d2d9de0ff9c12)
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Ignore KeyError for secret field

Although it doesn't make sense to create a datasource without
providing auth info in config info, it may be not possible to
define a schema to verify because different datasource drivers
may use different kinds of auth methods. So we should be able
to handle the case that none secret info is provided. The fix
just simply ignores KeyError exception here.

Change-Id: I06bc6a4fb659d862da96dd96557454b6385d003f
Closes-Bug: #1492354
(cherry picked from commit 22210a9ee65526ca0ccaf448260d2d9de0ff9c12)

When a tenant access a subresource, neutron will check that this
tenant is allowed to view this subresource, according to the policy.json.
The plugin must return the tenant_id parameter when a "show/list/delete"
action is performed, so that the policy framework can check authz.

This patch also set the network_id as a mandatory parameter

Change-Id: I59d2dbb5416b566dc7de3acb4fab3ed2ada8b78e
Fixes-Bug: #1512789
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add tenant-id to subresources

When a tenant access a subresource, neutron will check that this
tenant is allowed to view this subresource, according to the policy.json.
The plugin must return the tenant_id parameter when a "show/list/delete"
action is performed, so that the policy framework can check authz.

This patch also set the network_id as a mandatory parameter
in the network_association table.

Change-Id: I59d2dbb5416b566dc7de3acb4fab3ed2ada8b78e
Fixes-Bug: #1512789

commit_message:
Remove qpidd's driver from the tree

Back in liberty we marked this driver as deprecated. This patch removes
it from the tree. The patch also removes tests, options and other
references in the documentation. Note that one script is being kept
because it's required by the amqp driver.

Depends-On: If4b1773334e424d1f4a4e112bd1f10aca62682a9
Change-Id: I4a9cba314c4a2f24307504fa7b5427424268b114

commit_message:
Check prefix with startswith() instead of slicing

Replaced string slicing with startswith() method to check for prefixes.
The startswith() is cleaner and less error prone thus enhances the readibility and stability of the code.

Change-Id: Ia2e9a02128ef11cdf7512c96726503b85edc52aa

commit_message:
Adds test case for the iscsi_ilo recreate boot iso

When using web server for hosting images for ilo driver,
take_over should recreate the boot ISO, if it was created
by Ironic. This fix is done as part of the feature patch
I5481e705892f66cb3184ac16ff56c123f5c69087 in boot.py from
lines 117-122.
The test case for this bug is missing in the feature patch
and hence adding it here in this patch.

Related-Bug: #1510425

Change-Id: I6b7f3901f773a5aba906c50dcbd574412f7b6af3

commit_message:
Import pep3134daemon as local module

pep3134daemon is now imported from local path
rather than pip. This generated many issues
as the package is not in the global-requirements.txt
of kilo and liberty. Also pbr in the kilo release
does not support env markers which further complitated
the installation. This change needs to be backported to
stable/kilo also.

Also some minor fix for RST format.

Compared to the liberty commit this one is cherry-picked from, a few
modifications were needed:

requirements.txt : Tiny reorganisation
setup.py : Removal of the old platform-dependant deps installation

Change-Id: I34db28ffc928703b01e6430a661214d66d81c519
(cherry picked from commit 3abf2080f1ed0ec733e246af9ff877ac84159c52)

subject: Don't force Fn::Select index to integer
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-20 15:19:06.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/test_template.py', 'heat/engine/cfn/functions.py'], 'message': "Don't force Fn::Select index to integer

Fn::Select try to cast its index argument to integer in all the cases,
but it also needs to use it as a string when you give it a mapping. This
moves the cast after the mapping case has been handled.

Change-Id: I84ff404d3a26fb51c2048e43851b1ef5e3031d67
Closes-Bug: #1518337
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Don't force Fn::Select index to integer

Fn::Select try to cast its index argument to integer in all the cases,
but it also needs to use it as a string when you give it a mapping. This
moves the cast after the mapping case has been handled.

Change-Id: I84ff404d3a26fb51c2048e43851b1ef5e3031d67
Closes-Bug: #1518337

commit_message:
Refactor Mesos templates

Move Mesos master into its own nested template. This will make the
style consistent with k8s templates.

Change-Id: Icfb0df1b486febacc08f34ca86a58a80dc83f812
Partial-Implements: blueprint heat-network-refactor

commit_message:
Port EMC VMAX to Python 3

* Fix EMCVMAXMasking._get_storage_group_from_masking_view_instance():
  replace "if groups[0] > 0:" with "if len(groups):"
* tests-py3.txt: add cinder.tests.unit.test_emc_vmax

commit_message:
Port EMC VNX CLI to Python 3

CreateConsistencyGroupTask, WaitMigrationsCompleteTask: sort the lun
identifier keys to have a determinist order. On Python 3, the hash
function is randomized, so set() order is undefined and changes at
each run.

Other changes:

* Replace map() with list-comprehension to get a list on Python 3.
* Replace assertTrue(str.find(pattern) > 0) with
  assertIn(pattern, str) to not fail if pattern is at the beginning
  on the string. On Python 3, the hash function is randomized and so
  parts of the provider_location are in a random order, it can be at
  the beginning.
* tests-py3.txt: add cinder.tests.unit.test_emc_vnxdirect

Partial-Implements: blueprint cinder-python3
Change-Id: I114029c1c9862583e64781379001870a682ea42d

commit_message:
Use a dict to translate node power states to json data.

The input of set_power_state() is different from the real string
it sends to Ironic service in json data. The power states were
translated in set_power_state(). Using a dict to map the translation
is more clear, and easier to add new power states.

Change-Id: I8c7dac1ac39f92b2031e7f1fa95cd5c398a708d5
Implements: blueprint enhance-power-interface-for-soft-reboot-and-nmi
Related-to: blueprint soft-reboot-poweroff
Related-to: blueprint instance-crash-dump

commit_message:
Disallow user modifing ACTIVE_IMMUTABLE of deactivated images

Currently the user can change the ACTIVE_IMMUTABLE properties whilst
the image is 'deactivated'. This should not be the case once an image
has become 'active'.

APIImpact
Change-Id: I744fbce90893008ef49568c3cba47bf0e26dec9d
Closes-Bug: 1517060
Closes-Bug: 1517963

commit_message:
Add Reject option to Firewall Rules

Although Neutron API and Neutronclient support Reject action
in Firewall Rule, it is missing in Horizon. This change
proposes to add the 'Reject' action option to the Firewall
rule in the 'Add Rule' workflow and the 'Edit Rule' form.

Change-Id: Ibf6072948becdc1852464826a04f08127bd85113
Closes-Bug: #1516856
